Protirus deliver security programs for a large and diverse customer base. We support our customers with technical excellence, strategic experience and a unique ability to react to the unexpected. This is achieved through a combination of our Consulting Services and strong Products’ portfolio.Protirus’s Consulting Services provide Service Design, Program Management, Deployment & Integration and Operational Optimisation services to customers, carrying out projects from start to finish.The Development team are responsible for the development of our key Protirus Products; these Products are developed in-house and are used by organisations around the world to improve their security operations, whether this is by enhanced integrations with 3rd party products, creating dashboards, tailored security features or orchestration platforms.Additionally, our Development arm is a crucial contributing element to the Consulting Services, allowing Protirus to provide custom solutions to customer requirements, subsequently delivering cutting edge and comprehensive projects to our customers.Protirus’ customer list includes some of the world’s largest organisations, and our constant aim is to ensure we provide them unparalleled services and products. We believe that can only be achieved in an environment where creativity, collaboration, innovation, flexibility and trust are the foundations to the way of working.This is a full time permanent position, 40 hours per week Monday – Friday, starting in November.Job DescriptionYou will work closely with the Consulting team, assisting in providing tailored solutions to customer problems that can often impact the direction, pace or viability of a security program. You will work in a customer facing environment, and will work regularly with the Consultant team on their delivery too.You will also be working as part of an experienced development team who are responsible for developing and maintaining our current product portfolio, and any new products that may be designed.This involves working in an environment in which you will be required to interpret business requirements and translate those into technical low level solutions, following best practice process and practices.Our products are a mix of standalone solutions or enhanced integration with cyber security vendor products. This mix provides unique and challenging development experiences, and ensures that the development work we are delivering is always on the edge of what is possible.ExperienceWe are looking for candidates with the following skills and experience:RequiredProven ability to adapt to developing, troubleshooting and supporting tailored solutions and API integrations developed in c# (MVC), MS SQL and associated toolsets including elements such as workflow and process automation and orchestration.You must have:Excellent problem solving & analysis skillsAbility to work individually and as part of a team - manage your own time effectively and work to deadlinesExcellent communication skills with internal / external stakeholdersSuperb written and verbal communications skills in English.Flexible approach to customer engagementTravel when requiredAdditional areas of interest to ProtirusIn addition to the required elements above, Protirus would be very interested if you have experience with or understanding of any of the following items:Low and high level programming languages – C++, C# MVC (.net core / .net 5), SQL, Python, PowerShell, JQuery, Angular, ReactMobile app development framework - XamarinWorkflows and business process automation – e.g. ServiceNow and Salesforce Workflows, Symantec Workflow, DecisionsContainerisation - DockerDevOps Skills - CI Builds, Test Automation, Package & Deployment, Orchestration and associated tooling (e.g. Ansible / Kubernetes)Big Data (e.g. SIEM) - Splunk / Elastic (ELK) data transformation, data transformation and reporting, User Behaviour Analytics (UBA), Machine Learning / AI correlationCloud adoption – Data centre migrations, workload management, SAASJob Type: PermanentSalary: £25,000.00-£45,000.00 per yearBenefits:Additional leaveSick payWork from homeSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to Friday Protirus deliver security programs for a large and diverse customer base. About US

Ebury is a FinTech success story, and one of Europe's fastest-growing fintech companies.
We believe that in order for businesses to prosper and grow, there need to be as few boundaries as possible. We empower small and medium-sized businesses to trade and transact internationally through our state-of-the-art technology platform.
The talent of our 1000+ multicultural staff, combined with our cutting edge technology, tailored product range, and exceptional customer service has enabled us to double in size year after year. Today we have 22 offices across the world, with even more exciting expansion plans supported by a strategic partnership with Banco Santander. This is a unique opportunity to join at an exciting time for Ebury and to help us to grow our business significantly over the coming years.
None of this would have been possible without our proudest achievement: our great people. Enthusiastic, innovative and collaborative teams, always ready to disrupt and revolutionise the fast-paced Fintech sector.
Role
This is a new role within the Ebury Technology Department focussing on Mobile Apps development. Working side by side with the tech leaders, you will take responsibility for the Mobile Apps development as part of the Channels ecosystem within the Department. You will drive efficiencies and best practices as Ebury grows and matures over the coming years.
Your Background

Experience with building native iOS apps that delight users (Swift Code).

Experience writing applications in Flutter or react-Native would also be great.

Knowledge of Node.js or python is a plus.

Reviewing other people's code and knowing when to suggest improvements

Applying common architectural approaches eg: MVC MVP MVVM etc Referencing Apple's Human Interface Guidelines and collaborating with designers to build a native product experience Using a version control system such as Git Writing automated tests.

You have a good appreciation of security.

You have experience of working on scalable apps that see spikes in traffic / user sign-up

You share your ideas and continuously improve yourself and the team around you

Analysing and optimising UI and infrastructure application code for quality, efficiency, and performance is driven by data and application monitoring.

Since you will work side by side with colleagues from different countries, you will be able to communicate clearly and concisely your ideas in English both written and spoken.

We value experience with financial apps technologies.

Quality is important to us, we expect your code to be testable and well covered with unit and integration tests. We use CI Jenkins pipelines for the deployment of services and infrastructure. From time to time, you might need to contribute to it.

The Project

You will contribute to the development of a transactional banking platform, focusing on receiving and issuing payments in more than 140 currencies.
Our platform is a single platform (20+ Services) with distinct channels for users to access our core functionality.

Help in defining, communicating and driving the Mobile Apps within Ebury and its engineering teams.

Implementation of solutions to ensure Ebury’s Mobile Apps Channel provides smooth and quick values to customers.

Build and Run services in production. Using tools such as Jenkins, Terraform, Sentry, Prometheus, ELK.. you and your team will be responsible for achieving Service Level Objectives for your code.

Work with cross-functional product and technology teams across the company to build new features at large and multi-region scale.

All of these run smoothly in Docker containers on AWS ECS and Kubernetes.

What We Offer
You will be part of a remote-first distributed technology team that cares deeply about people, culture and best practices, and believes in agile principles. Take a look here and see what our team say about us!
You’ll have continuous professional growth thanks to our career progression framework with regular reviews.
You’ll improve your personal development through training and certification.
You’ll contribute to our technical design through our open and collaborative Request For Comments (RFC) process.
We are Open Source friendly, following Open Source principles in our internal projects and encouraging contributions to external projects.
An in-depth onboarding process to make you feel part of the team from your first day.
If you wish to improve your English skills, you’ll be able to take lessons in the school of your choice.
Due to our remote-first organisation and our remote-focused onboarding system, you will feel a crucial part of the team since day one. Curious about what working remotely is like at Ebury? Take a look and see what our team say about us!
If there’s something that you can do in our Tech team, it is growing professionally: thanks to our career path and our collaborative and cross-team working, every day is a new adventure. Get ready to take your career to the next level
We believe in inclusion. We stand against discrimination in all forms and have no tolerance for the intolerance of differences that makes us a modern and successful organisation. At Ebury, you can be whoever you want to be and still feel a sense of belonging no matter your story because we want you and your uniqueness to help write our future.

Bitfinex is a digital asset trading platform offering state-of-the-art services for digital currency traders and global liquidity providers.Founded in 2012, Bitfinex was one of the first professional platforms set up to accommodate for the booming interest in cryptocurrency trading. Since then, our team has gained invaluable experience whilst cementing our spot as the go-to platform for digital asset traders and institutions.Our MissionOur aim is to create a free and accessible global digital economy by disrupting the current financial services industry.Our team is entirely remote, composed of individuals with an ownership mentality; no one waits to be told what to do. Each member of the team is a highly motivated self-starter that is comfortable with autonomy and believes in lifelong learning. When we’re not working, we’re dreaming about it. We place our egos aside and thrive within a culture that fosters one another from the birth of a concept to launch of a product.At Bitfinex you have the freedom to work as you please - all that matters is execution.Join us and help lay the foundation for a decentralized future.Key responsibilitiesAs a Front-end Developer, you will be a part of the team that works on the development of the Bitfinex web and mobile applications. This includes:New Features - Bitfinex continuously strives to create innovative new features in order to provide the most professional trading experience for customers. These are developed and deployed using agile methodologies, to ensure the user experience remains the best in the industry.Scalability - The web application must remain effortlessly smooth, responsive, and real-time for customers as the platform continues to scale to accommodate new user growth.Data Visualisation - The data we present to our users is the result of tailored algorithms, on top of the incredible amount of data our platform produces daily, and we continue to experiment with new ways to display this most effectively.Design - Build beautiful reactive applications and trading tools.RequirementsTo enjoy this role, you should possess the personal attributes and experience outlined above. ABOUT
We are a leading web and mobile development agency based in the South East of England. We have a passion for designing and building bespoke software with a strong focus on best practise, with a strong focus on high standards and continuous improvement. We also use open source technology wherever we can and strive to contribute back to the open-source community as we can.
Our Values: fun, collaboration and expertise!
RECIPE FOR SUCCESS
Experience building, testing and releasing apps through the App Store and Play Store.
Compliance with Apple and Google's rules, managing certificates and keystores and setting up app store profiles from nothing.
Ability to unpack client requirements and make decisions about how best to implement them.
Ability to lead and guide a team of less experienced developers.
Comfortable to help us build out of Mobile Strategy and offering.
CORE IGNREDIENTS (a combination of the following:)
Mobile/Web application design and architecture
Git and collaborative development workflow
Build applications (React Native, Typescript, Javascript)
Translating designs into UI Workflows and screens (HTML, CSS)
Experience of releasing to the App Stores, Testing platforms (TestFlight, EAS or similar)
Unit testing
WHAT WE OFFER
A competitive salary (D.O.E)
25 days holiday per year plus bank holidays
Company contributed pension plan
Annual pay review
Pro rata profit share bonus based on company and individual performance
Quarterly review process
Regular training and conference opportunities
Hybrid remote/office working with fruit bowl, smoothies and soft drinks
Flexible working hours
Regular social events

Job Description
Contract Summary
Frontend Developer / FE Developer / React DeveloperRemote / Hybrid working available
Endeavor Streaming, part of Endeavor, is building the world’s most advanced content distribution platform for Content Creators, Global Brands, TV Broadcasters and Sports Federations.
The role:
We are looking for front-end developers to join our brilliant client side development teams. The teams responsibilities include web (desktop, mobile/tablet, 10ft), native (mobile/tablet, 10ft) and playback (all devices) development.
We build and maintain a variety of modern apps, including cross-platform and multi language user facing streaming (live and on demand) applications, a number of custom back office portals to support them, our very own player engine (across all platforms), and everything in between (e.g. common private packages, lambdas).
Our stack is based on TypeScript, React, Node.js and AWS.
Required Skills:
JS (ES6)
CSS
React knowledge
Nice to have skills:
TypeScript
eye for design
React Native

Company Summary
Product Madness is one of the world's largest mobile game studios, with a global presence. Founded in 2007, we’re today a top-grossing leader in social casino mobile games that are crafted with passion and commitment. Our ambition is to entertain millions of players around the world with our remarkable titles that include Heart of Vegas, Cashman Casino, Lighting Link and FaFaFa™ Gold.
We are Mad about games and the way they bring people together, and that passion and culture is what holds us together as a studio, connects us with the partners we collaborate with, and is what links us to our sister studios across the world.
Job Posting Title
Unity Developer
Summary
We are looking for a developer to join one of our game development teams based in London. You’re expected to have a good understanding of object oriented programming, design patterns, also a thorough understanding of graphics, performance issues and trade-offs, great attention to detail and ability to work with deadlines.

Your role will be hands-on in the development of new features and also supporting existing ones, writing unit tests and code reviews. As a developer you’ll be asked to provide support and mentor junior developers, and take part in technical discussions. You’ll work closely with producers, designers, and developers in a highly collaborative and genuinely agile environment.
What You'll Do
Skills and Requirements
Experience working with Unity
Strong experience working with C#
Has worked with mobile platforms in previous roles
An understanding with design patterns and design principles
Worked with UI & Unity graphics pipeline
Building flexible and reusable systems
What We're Looking For
About You
Best practices such as TDD, BDD, ect.
Shipped mobile titles into production
Knowledge of network protocols work
Experience with client-server communication
Experience with UML and/or diagrams
Why Product Madness?
Product Madness is so much more than just a Pool table and a foosball game.
We believe in an honest and transparent approach with our teammates. Company wide weekly Town Halls, All Hands and strategy meetings are just a few ways in which we encourage an open and honest path to achieving complete transparency.
Despite a pandemic, there isn’t a day where we don’t feel connected to one another.
With frequent events, workshops, giveaways, slack coffee and donut sessions we have definitely brought on our office culture to this new virtual world of zoom calls.
We also try to cater for all our staff’s needs – be that a freshly brewed cappuccino made by our professional barista in our free coffee shop or by providing a bountiful supply of tasty snacks to keep us refueled and buzzing.
We love to organise plenty of social get-togethers and action-packed activity days, be it slipping inside an inflatable bumper ball for a mad session of football zorbing or throwing caution to the wind and traversing giddy treetop rope courses at Go Ape. On top of these team-building activities, our lunch and learn workshops, not to mention the lavish Christmas and summer parties, foster that ‘work hard, play hard’ mantra. Our offices are based in the heart of the metropolises of London and Lviv, surrounded by an abundance of diversity and inspiration to keep those ideas flowing.
Our Values
People First
We have the deepest respect for our people and their well being. We know they are exceptionally talented and will always have a choice. We want them to re-choose us every day. We are committed to building a culture where each person's voice will always be heard and addressed.
MAD for More
Always improving, innovating and never settling for the existing. We push all boundaries with courage and ambition to become the world’s best games company.
Champion Together

We excel at what we do but yet remain humble and helpful to our teammates. We champion one another and hold each other to high standards without any egos.
Globally Inclusive
We are all Equal - regardless of the language we speak, where we live, our gender, religion or culture we come from. We want to build a global home, where everyone has the equal opportunity to make an impact.
Customer Focused
We always think from the customer's perspective - be it players or internal customers.
Improving their experience and joy is what drives us. Every client's success is our big win! Company Summary
Product Madness is one of the world's largest mobile game studios, with a global presence. Founded in 2007, we’re today a top-grossing leader in social casino mobile games that are crafted with passion and commitment. We are looking for a qualified Front-end developer to join our IT team. You will be responsible for building the ‘client-side’ of our web applications. You should be able to translate our company and customer needs into functional and appealing interactive applications.If you’re interested in creating a user-friendly environment by writing code and moving forward in your career, then this job is for you. We expect you to be a tech-savvy professional, who is curious about new digital technologies and aspires to combine usability with visual design.Ultimately, you should be able to create a functional and attractive digital environment for our company, ensuring great user experience.Responsibilities· Use markup languages like HTML to create user-friendly web pages· Maintain and improve website· Optimize applications for maximum speed· Design mobile-based features· Collaborate with back-end developers and web designers to improve usability· Get feedback from, and build solutions for, users and customers· Write functional requirement documents and guides· Create quality mockups and prototypes· Help back-end developers with coding and troubleshooting· Ensure high quality graphic standards and brand consistency· Stay up-to-date on emerging technologiesRequirements and skills· Proven work experience as a Front-end developer· Hands on experience with markup languages· Experience with JavaScript, CSS and jQuery· Familiarity with browser testing and debugging· In-depth understanding of the entire web development process (design, development and deployment)· Understanding of layout aesthetics· Knowledge of SEO principles· Familiarity with software like Adobe Suite, Photoshop and content management systems· An ability to perform well in a fast-paced environment· Excellent analytical and multitasking skills· BSc degree in Computer Science or relevant fieldHideJob Types: Full-time, Fixed term contractContract length: 6 monthsSalary: £450.00-£475.00 per daySchedule:8 hour shiftAbility to commute/relocate:London, Greater London: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required) We are looking for a qualified Front-end developer to join our IT team. At Champion Health we're all about empowering employee wellbeing through our personalized and proactive platform that helps employers make a real difference to every member of their organisation.We have recently developed and released our iOS and Android mobile apps which aim to put employees in control of their wellbeing through personalised action plans, insights and advice from experts in all areas of wellbeing, performance and life.We are now looking for an enthusiastic mobile developer with React Native experience to help us improve and expand on the features we provide to our users. While some commercial experience in developing mobile applications is desirable we are equally open to applicants who can demostrate the relevant skills through their own personal projects. We want someone who can grow into the role and take full ownership of the app front end development and deploy updates to app stores.This role is 100% remote and will be joining an expanding team of 2 other full time developers who are handling the back end API and web version of our product. You will need a positive, problem solving attitude and a clear enthusiasm for building apps. Position Overview
We are looking for an enthusiastic C++ software engineer with a strong all-round grounding to work principally on the Football Manager Mobile project. Ideally, you'll be a big football fan and will be keen to involve yourself across different areas of the codebase - whether it's overhauling a gameplay module, fixing bugs, or implementing new screens or functionality in the game's User interface. You'll become an integral part of a small, close-knit team where everyone's opinion is valued, and will have the opportunity to work closely with the Game Director, Producers, Designers and Artists.

This position will suit someone motivated and detail-oriented, who will be keen to continue developing their own knowledge as well as using their communication skills to help the team improve as a whole. While this is a mobile project, we develop in C++ and value the skills and passion you can show us above mobile gaming experience, though some knowledge of Unity would be a plus.
Key Responsibilities
Design and develop new gameplay functionality, principally for mobile
Improve and maintain existing gameplay modules
Contribute to the development of new user interface functionality
Work with other teams at SI to help integrate shared code where necessary
Analyse, debug and fix issues
Work closely with artists, developers and producers to help push our games to be better
Knowledge, Skills and Experience
Essential:
Demonstrable professional experience using C++ as the main language
Strong programming skills in C++, with knowledge of modern standards and best practices
Knowledge of and passion for football
Ability to write clean, maintainable, and portable code
Good debugging and problem-solving skills
Self-motivated and able to work closely with team members across all disciplines
Comfortable using both Windows and Mac
 Desirable:
Interest in game design
Experience with mobile gaming and cross-platform development
Professional experience using Unity for game development
Studio Overview
Sports Interactive (SI) is an ambitious development studio creating immersive sports management simulations. Since 1994, we’ve captivated a global pool of players with our iconic, BAFTA award-winning game, Football Manager. We’re a wholly owned subsidiary of SEGA having caught their attention in 2006 with our continuous critical and commercial success.

We’re a tenacious community, coming together at the Here East technology hub in Stratford, East London. Always expanding, the SI team takes on the gaming genre through a diverse array of disciplines. But no matter how big we dream, we keep our approach (and your schedule) flexible, creating a relaxed atmosphere where collaboration can thrive.
Working Here
We approach everything with passion, whether that’s making our mark on the gaming and football industries or doing our bit for the world around us. We want to share that outlook with everyone who shows up to work here each day.
We like our talent tenacious, so you can expect to surround yourself with other ambitious individuals bringing their A-game to many different disciplines. We know collaboration is the key to constantly topping our best, and encourage our people to fiercely realise their own personal potential.
We believe everyone matters, no matter which part of the business you’re in. Above all else, we’re a team. A team with a down-to-earth dynamic, that works and plays together. We have fun doing what we do; one of the many reasons we’re one of the best places to work in the UK games business (Gameindustry.biz 2021 Large studio category).
And if you want a work/life balance, we’re behind you. Because while we live to create extraordinary games, we know that’s not all you’ve got going on. You can trust that we always keep things in perspective, fostering an environment where work can be more than just a job.
Our flexible working culture gives team members the responsibility to optimise their workloads, with in-office, hybrid and remote working options. Even in countries where we don’t directly employ*, we’ll even explore what’s possible via third parties and do our best to accommodate location preferences.
And when you’re not here making the world’s best management games, there’s a top-class benefits package for permanent team members based in the UK, including gym membership, private health, and dental care, plus many more perks. For those permanent team members outside of the UK, we strive to offer equivalent and localised benefits. We’re also a London Living Wage employer and proudly boast one of the lowest staff turnover rates in the industry.We’re able to directly employ in the UK, Ireland, France, Sweden and Finland.
Inclusivity Matters


We’re proud to be an equal opportunities employer and encourage applications from any relevant candidate irrespective of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy or maternity, religion, or belief. Our studio has disabled access and facilities.
This job description is an accurate reflection of the duties and responsibilities of the post as at the time of writing but will be changed from time to time as the job is a career development job which will be adjusted according to the progress of the job holder. It does not form part of the contract of employment. Position Overview
We are looking for an enthusiastic C++ software engineer with a strong all-round grounding to work principally on the Football Manager Mobile project. Ideally, you'll be a big football fan and will be keen to involve yourself across different areas of the codebase - whether it's overhauling a gameplay module, fixing bugs, or implementing new screens or functionality in the game's User interface. You'll become an integral part of a small, close-knit team where everyone's opinion is valued, and will have the opportunity to work closely with the Game Director, Producers, Designers and Artists.

This position will suit someone motivated and detail-oriented, who will be keen to continue developing their own knowledge as well as using their communication skills to help the team improve as a whole. While this is a mobile project, we develop in C++ and value the skills and passion you can show us above mobile gaming experience, though some knowledge of Unity would be a plus.
Key Responsibilities
Design and develop new gameplay functionality, principally for mobile
Improve and maintain existing gameplay modules
Contribute to the development of new user interface functionality
Work with other teams at SI to help integrate shared code where necessary
Analyse, debug and fix issues
Work closely with artists, developers and producers to help push our games to be better
Knowledge, Skills and Experience
Essential:
Demonstrable professional experience using C++ as the main language
Strong programming skills in C++, with knowledge of modern standards and best practices
Knowledge of and passion for football
Ability to write clean, maintainable, and portable code
Good debugging and problem-solving skills
Self-motivated and able to work closely with team members across all disciplines
Comfortable using both Windows and Mac
 Desirable:
Interest in game design
Experience with mobile gaming and cross-platform development
Professional experience using Unity for game development
Studio Overview
Sports Interactive (SI) is an ambitious development studio creating immersive sports management simulations. Since 1994, we’ve captivated a global pool of players with our iconic, BAFTA award-winning game, Football Manager. We’re a wholly owned subsidiary of SEGA having caught their attention in 2006 with our continuous critical and commercial success.

We’re a tenacious community, coming together at the Here East technology hub in Stratford, East London. Always expanding, the SI team takes on the gaming genre through a diverse array of disciplines. But no matter how big we dream, we keep our approach (and your schedule) flexible, creating a relaxed atmosphere where collaboration can thrive.
Working Here
We approach everything with passion, whether that’s making our mark on the gaming and football industries or doing our bit for the world around us. We want to share that outlook with everyone who shows up to work here each day.
We like our talent tenacious, so you can expect to surround yourself with other ambitious individuals bringing their A-game to many different disciplines. We know collaboration is the key to constantly topping our best, and encourage our people to fiercely realise their own personal potential.
We believe everyone matters, no matter which part of the business you’re in. Above all else, we’re a team. A team with a down-to-earth dynamic, that works and plays together. We have fun doing what we do; one of the many reasons we’re one of the best places to work in the UK games business (Gameindustry.biz 2021 Large studio category).
And if you want a work/life balance, we’re behind you. Because while we live to create extraordinary games, we know that’s not all you’ve got going on. You can trust that we always keep things in perspective, fostering an environment where work can be more than just a job.
Our flexible working culture gives team members the responsibility to optimise their workloads, with in-office, hybrid and remote working options. Even in countries where we don’t directly employ*, we’ll even explore what’s possible via third parties and do our best to accommodate location preferences.
And when you’re not here making the world’s best management games, there’s a top-class benefits package for permanent team members based in the UK, including gym membership, private health, and dental care, plus many more perks. For those permanent team members outside of the UK, we strive to offer equivalent and localised benefits. We’re also a London Living Wage employer and proudly boast one of the lowest staff turnover rates in the industry.We’re able to directly employ in the UK, Ireland, France, Sweden and Finland.
Inclusivity Matters

Position – Website Developer & DesignerFull Time – 40 Hours a weekEmployer – EbMCsquaredSalary - £30,000/yearStart Date – Aug/September 2022Contract – Permanent subject to 3 Month ProbationJob Description: The World Council for Health is looking for a dynamic, positive, and experienced Website Developer & Designer. This role would involve maintaining key websites for WCH, BiRD, EbMCsquared and Source. This is a multi-faceted and at time pressurised project and as such would need to be taken on by someone who is driven, committed to the cause and has fine attention to detail. The Websites that are the most active and updated are WCH and Source (the latter is yet to be launched). All our websites are WordPress sites.You will ideally be experienced in Website Development, Website Security and Content Optimization. Everyone that works with WCH has to be a ‘captain and a soldier’ i.e. willing to pick up the work where the gaps are and when deadlines need to be met. Flexibility is needed as our online events are at varying and sometimes unsociable hours, and we will need tech support for these.The ideal candidate would be grounded with the ability to get tasks done quickly and a can-do attitude.Having good boundaries is a must. You will be working closely with the WCH Manager, Director, Content Manager and Translation Co-ordinator. Ideally you will have some branding knowledge and be able to help steer the sites in the direction they need to go.About the WCH: EbMCsquared is a community interest, non-profit start-up organization that is funded by grassroots donations. Since launching, our achievements have been profoundly impactful on a global scale, and it is imperative that we keep the same momentum as we grow. The WCH is in the process of decentralisation, so this role is key to the success of that. You will have the opportunity to contribute to real change in the world and to people’s lives with this role.The role includes but is not limited to: Developing the website – Making key improvements to the site to help improve useability and accessibility.Design – Keeping the sites ‘on brand’ to fine tune our brand and image to aid growth and accessibility.Maintaining the website – Uploading key content each week, videos, articles and statements as well as any new campaigns, blog posts etc. Maintaining the speed of the site.Security – Ensuring the website is regularly backed up and secure from threats.Ensure assets look good across all devices, mobile being the primary visitors to our sites.SEO – Technical Optimisation, Search Engine Marketing and viewership and performance reports.Ensure compliance with Data protection and privacy regulations.Familiarity with cloud solutions such as Microsoft 365Daily IT management functions for our usersExpected: +2 years’ experience K3K Networks Limited, UK is a global IT services company providing value-added high quality IT solutions to our clients in selected horizontal and vertical segments, by combining technology skills, domain expertise, process focus and a commitment for long-term client relationships.
We are looking for Mobile Application developers, to work on existing mobile applications in the areas of M-Commerce, CRM and Telecom. We are looking for talented & passionate individuals, who have the experience in Android or iOS Mobile platforms.
Job Description
Building scalable apps across multiple platforms and device resolutions
End to End App Development – New apps
Taking over existing mobile projects for maintenance and amendments
Submissions to the Apple Store or Google Play
TECHNICAL SKILLS – ANDROID/iOS
Building scalable apps across multiple platforms and device resolutions
End to End App Development – New apps
Taking over existing mobile projects for maintenance and amendments
Submissions to the Apple Store or Google Play
TECHNICAL SKILLS – ANDROID/iOS
Working with Designers on Wireframes to App Submission
Experience developing on the Android Platform or iOS-XCode/ipad/iphone
Extensive Objective-C & Cocoa Touch programming experience
Knowledge of Android native technologies (Java, Android SDK, Eclipse ADB)
Knowledge of Android-specific UI patterns and affordances.
Experience in REST-APIs integration (XML and JSON based application development
Experience using Social Media APIs
Experience of cloud-based storage integration
Good Knowledge on Android UX/UI guidelines best practices
Understanding of Apples App Store provisioning & Apple best practices
Experience in Agile Development Methodologies
He/ She needs to have relevant experience with good education background preferably degree level. Job Description
Mobile App Developer

IPhone Developer:
Experience: 2 Years Minimum
Responsibility
Design and build applications for the iOS platform
Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications
Collaborate with a team to define, design, and ship new features
Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs
Help maintain code quality, organisation, and automatisation

Skills
Proficient with Objective-C or Swift {{depending on project requirements}}, and Cocoa Touch
Experience with iOS frameworks such as Core Data, Core Animation, etc.
Experience with offline storage, threading, and performance tuning
Familiarity with RESTful APIs to connect iOS applications to back-end services
Knowledge of other web technologies and UI/UX standards
Understanding of Apple’s design principles and interface guidelines
Knowledge of low-level C-based libraries is preferred
Experience with performance and memory tuning with tools {{such as Instruments and Shark, depending on project needs}}
Familiarity with cloud message APIs and push notifications
Proficient understanding of code versioning tools {{such as Git or SVN}}
Familiarity with continuous integration, pods and application deployment over iTunes

About You:

A fantastic opportunity has become available for a talented front-end developer with a real passion for creativity within a multi award winning digital marketing agency.

We are looking for an exceptional individual who is immersed in digital, who understands the power of a technically great website and how to get it to the highest standard regardless of the platform. The ideal candidate would want to succeed so we’ll give you what you need to perform at your best, because we believe true growth starts from within our agency team.

About the Role:
As the front-end developer, you will provide support to our development team and other marketing departments across all areas of technical SEO, landing page building, and custom coding web pages and functionalities. You will be working with a broad range of CMS platforms across a range of projects and will help departments to achieve their campaign successes with quick turnaround times and well-communicated output.

Applicants should have experience writing custom HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Expertise in writing semantic, modular front-end code using HTML5, CSS3, and W3C coding practices a must. Understanding of the concepts of progressive enhancement, mobile first (RWD) and future friendly design highly encouraged. Experience with Front end frameworks such as Bootstrap also desirable.

Our new Digital PR Senior Executive will take responsibility and ownership for certain aspects of client activity, ultimately to lessen the workload of the Team Lead. The Digital PR Senior Executive will act as a point of contact of a select number of client accounts and be accountable for their ongoing Digital PR performance.
What we’ll need from you:

You’ll enjoy maintaining and modifying our client websites.
You’ll be supporting the development team with website launches and migrations (redirect strategies, content migration, crawl-budget optimisation).

You’ll need to collaborate with the UX Design Lead and support with implementation.
The ability to Resolve Core Web Vital issues.
The ability to structure Data implementation according to Google guidelines.
Building email templates with visual builder or using HTML / CSS
Build landing page with visual builder or using WordPress native script.
The ability to resolve technical SEO issues for websites.
Support our SEO, PPC, Content and PR team for content upload and formatting for different CMS platform.
Support SEO and PPC department with Ecommerce tracking setup/troubleshooting.
The ability to liaise directly with clients where required, and to professionally handle client feedback.
The ability to provide accurate estimates for tasks and timescales.
Strong attention to detail
Ability to prioritise tasks and remain adaptable to changing priorities based on client and internal demand.
Knowledge of structured data, site speed optimisation, core web vitals and how these intertwine with SEO best practice.

Key skills you’ll need:
You’ll enjoy maintaining and modifying our client websites.You’ll be supporting the development team with website launches and migrations (redirect strategies, content migration, crawl-budget optimisation).

Knowledge of various CMS platforms and frameworks, such as WordPress, Shopify, Joomla, Magento, Lavarel and Drupal
Experience using and implementing Google Analytics, Search Console, Tag Manager and other tracking tools
Core technical skills with HTML, CSS, JavaScript and expertise in writing semantic, modular front-end code.
Understanding of browser-based development tools (Lighthouse, Tag Assistant, Chrome dev tool etc).
Willingness to learn about other areas in the marketing mix and how digital fits together.
A good understanding of UX and conversion best practice
Working knowledge of Adobe XD & Photoshop desirable.
Proactivity, forward thinking and the ability to take the initiative is essential
Advanced technical knowledge such as usage of log files for SEO analysis and familiarity in working with popular JS frameworks such as AngularJS, React and Vue.j
Fully remote working in the UK (opportunities to work from anywhere within Europe – exceptions apply).
Free Private Medical Health Insurance (with cash back option on Vision & Dental care & 40% off Nuffield Health gym Membership)
3 Wellness days provided each year.
Company Pension Scheme.
Opportunities to progress if you’re up for the challenge.
Training sessions galore across multiple disciplines.
Opportunities to speak at industry events and conferences if you want to.
A library, where you can select a book of your choice and we will send it to you for free.
The opportunity to be involved in our charity fundraising events.
A birthday gift and the afternoon off on us.
Extra treats on your work-versary (annually)
Opportunity to take part in a professional PT session each week.
Absolute Early Bird (8am-5pm) OR Absolute Owl (9am-6pm) working hours offered to suit your lifestyle.
Regular social events and team building activities provided for free (online and in person).
Annual festivals
Monthly company-wide “feel good” meetings.
Early finish on the last Friday of every month.
Quarterly in person meet ups for the whole company. About You:

Engineering & Science
Mid-senior level
Malmö, Sweden | Stockholm, Sweden | Willenhall, England, United Kingdom | Woking, England, United Kingdom | Yavne, Israel | Zabierzów, Poland
Apply
Mobile IOS App Developer


A career where you are involved in making peoples home safer and smarter by exciting connected consumer products?


Location: Preferably in Malmo area in Sweden but we will consider applicants from any Europe location, provided that you are within a reasonable distance of an ASSA ABLOY location and an international airport.


Standard Hours: We will consider applicants looking for full-time position

Yale Doorman and Yale Linus, are the first of many exciting new smart locks that together with alarm systems and surveillance cameras will make peoples homes smarter and safer. We continue to grow our development team in Malmö, Sweden.


Right now we are looking for a IOS application developer.


Do you have a burning interest in writing code, and are eager to work in a global context?! Take this opportunity to reach out to us!


The successful candidate will help to deliver new features and maintain the IOS application for next generation of smart door locks. The phone application interfaces our product locally via Bluetooth/Wifi and remote over the internet via our servers. We are leading the development of new connection technologies such as Matter. It will involve working in a cross functional, product development team comprising of product management, backend developers, app developers, and other technical specialists spanning from Asia, via Malmo, Europe and into Silicon Valley. You will not only learn, but also you will be part of delivering real products used by consumers globally.


Yale Smart Residential, part of Assa Abloy, with offices a stone's throw from Malmö Central, has an exciting opportunity for an IOS developer. Yale Smart Residential has a young, dynamic, global organization with development sites in Malmö, San Francisco, Seoul and Shanghai.


Could this be your ideal opportunity? If so, keep reading!


The Opportunity

The Mobile IOS App Developer will work with the organisation to maintain, update and evolve the critical part of the product offer and user experience - the mobile application...


Besides this, your key duties will include but are not limited to:
Participate in IOS mobile app development.
Help to turn feature requirements into solution with consideration to scalability, modularity, robustness, uptime and security.
Work in a small team and be hands-on; coding, prototyping etc.
What You’ll Bring

The ideal candidate will demonstrate the following characteristics:

Senior IOS developer
Demonstrable knowledge of IOS development preferably with experience from IoT, Bluetooth technologies or similar technologies for consumer products.
Knowledge of software development methods and toolchains
An exceptional eye for detail, whilst understanding broader context
An excellent team player but also able to contribute on an individual basis.
Excellent problem-solving abilities, with ability to provide solutions on an individual basis.
Must be inquisitive and show willingness to continuously improve and learn.
Willing to work in an international environment, with occasional travel.
About Us

ASSA ABLOY is the global leader in access solutions. Featuring four times in Forbes’ most innovative companies worldwide, we deliver innovative, safe and convenient security solutions that provide real added value to our customers. As a group, our goal is to every day help billions of people experience a more open world.

We’re proud to boast leading positions across the majority of Europe, North and South America, Asia and Oceania, offering products and services to our customers seeking solutions to their entrance and opening requirements, such as locks, doors and entrance automation.


Yale is the global residential brand within the ASSA ABLOY group, with a presence practically across all territories. Originating back in the 1840’s, the Yale brand has more recently been making great strides into the world of digital, and smart products. With a focus on smart door locks, alarm systems, IP cameras and CCTV systems, and solutions for in-home service deliveries. We are now accelerating this initiative further, with very aggressive growth plans for the years to come.
The Yale Smart Residential team will be intensifying our R&D investments to support these very inspiring growth plans.


Your Role in Keeping the Future in Safe Hands

The Opening Solutions EMEIA division leads the development of products to provide safe and secure access solutions to homes, businesses and institutions.
The Yale Smart Residential team are passionate about innovation to pave the way for a successful and rewarding future…a vision which you could be part of! As a highly cohesive and truly diverse function, you will have a real opportunity to impact the strategic direction of the organisation.

Why Join Us

We know that our people enable us to be world leaders and since they help us grow, we want to do the same by offering plenty of opportunities to grow with us through our vast range of training and development initiatives. Your career is in your hands as much as it is ours and we adopt a collaborative approach and focus on individual development that empowers you and supports learning every day.
You’ll be surrounded by creative people and innovative thinkers who together all play a part in transforming our industry and if it’s a truly international career you’re looking for, you can find that here too! With bases in more than 70 countries and global headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden, the opportunities to unlock your potential are endless. With so many reasons to join ASSA ABLOY, become part of our diverse team and help us create a safe, secure and more open world.

We offer a competitive package, with continuous opportunities to learn and grow.

Ready to apply?
You can visit our Careers page to find out more about ASSA ABLOY, or submit your application by clicking ‘Apply Now’. For further information, contact Jenny Edwards, HR Advisor EMEIA.
When you join Yale, we open doors for you
We’re trusted by millions of people every day to keep what’s important to them safe. Their home, family and belongings. Looking after our people is just as important to us.

When you join our Yale team, you’ll also be part of the ASSA ABLOY Group, the global leader in access solutions. You’ll have 50,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.

As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

With so many reasons to join ASSA ABLOY, become part of our diverse team and help us create a safe, secure and more open world.

We offer a competitive package, with continuous opportunities to learn and grow.

Ready to apply?
You can visit our Careers page to find out more about ASSA ABLOY, or submit your application by clicking ‘Apply Now’. For further information, contact Jenny Edwards, HR Advisor EMEIA. 
Mobile IOS App Developer


A career where you are involved in making peoples home safer and smarter by exciting connected consumer products?


Location: Preferably in Malmo area in Sweden but we will consider applicants from any Europe location, provided that you are within a reasonable distance of an ASSA ABLOY location and an international airport.


Standard Hours: We will consider applicants looking for full-time position

Yale Doorman and Yale Linus, are the first of many exciting new smart locks that together with alarm systems and surveillance cameras will make peoples homes smarter and safer. We continue to grow our development team in Malmö, Sweden.


Right now we are looking for a IOS application developer.


Do you have a burning interest in writing code, and are eager to work in a global context?! Take this opportunity to reach out to us!


The successful candidate will help to deliver new features and maintain the IOS application for next generation of smart door locks. The phone application interfaces our product locally via Bluetooth/Wifi and remote over the internet via our servers. We are leading the development of new connection technologies such as Matter. It will involve working in a cross functional, product development team comprising of product management, backend developers, app developers, and other technical specialists spanning from Asia, via Malmo, Europe and into Silicon Valley. You will not only learn, but also you will be part of delivering real products used by consumers globally.


Yale Smart Residential, part of Assa Abloy, with offices a stone's throw from Malmö Central, has an exciting opportunity for an IOS developer. Yale Smart Residential has a young, dynamic, global organization with development sites in Malmö, San Francisco, Seoul and Shanghai.


Could this be your ideal opportunity? If so, keep reading!


The Opportunity

The Mobile IOS App Developer will work with the organisation to maintain, update and evolve the critical part of the product offer and user experience - the mobile application...


Besides this, your key duties will include but are not limited to:
Participate in IOS mobile app development.
Help to turn feature requirements into solution with consideration to scalability, modularity, robustness, uptime and security.
Work in a small team and be hands-on; coding, prototyping etc.
What You’ll Bring

The ideal candidate will demonstrate the following characteristics:

Senior IOS developer
Demonstrable knowledge of IOS development preferably with experience from IoT, Bluetooth technologies or similar technologies for consumer products.
Knowledge of software development methods and toolchains
An exceptional eye for detail, whilst understanding broader context
An excellent team player but also able to contribute on an individual basis.
Excellent problem-solving abilities, with ability to provide solutions on an individual basis.
Must be inquisitive and show willingness to continuously improve and learn.
Willing to work in an international environment, with occasional travel.
About Us

ASSA ABLOY is the global leader in access solutions. Featuring four times in Forbes’ most innovative companies worldwide, we deliver innovative, safe and convenient security solutions that provide real added value to our customers. As a group, our goal is to every day help billions of people experience a more open world.

We’re proud to boast leading positions across the majority of Europe, North and South America, Asia and Oceania, offering products and services to our customers seeking solutions to their entrance and opening requirements, such as locks, doors and entrance automation.


Yale is the global residential brand within the ASSA ABLOY group, with a presence practically across all territories. Originating back in the 1840’s, the Yale brand has more recently been making great strides into the world of digital, and smart products. With a focus on smart door locks, alarm systems, IP cameras and CCTV systems, and solutions for in-home service deliveries. We are now accelerating this initiative further, with very aggressive growth plans for the years to come.
The Yale Smart Residential team will be intensifying our R&D investments to support these very inspiring growth plans.


Your Role in Keeping the Future in Safe Hands

The Opening Solutions EMEIA division leads the development of products to provide safe and secure access solutions to homes, businesses and institutions.
The Yale Smart Residential team are passionate about innovation to pave the way for a successful and rewarding future…a vision which you could be part of! As a highly cohesive and truly diverse function, you will have a real opportunity to impact the strategic direction of the organisation.

Why Join Us

We know that our people enable us to be world leaders and since they help us grow, we want to do the same by offering plenty of opportunities to grow with us through our vast range of training and development initiatives. Your career is in your hands as much as it is ours and we adopt a collaborative approach and focus on individual development that empowers you and supports learning every day.
You’ll be surrounded by creative people and innovative thinkers who together all play a part in transforming our industry and if it’s a truly international career you’re looking for, you can find that here too! With bases in more than 70 countries and global headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden, the opportunities to unlock your potential are endless. With so many reasons to join ASSA ABLOY, become part of our diverse team and help us create a safe, secure and more open world.

We offer a competitive package, with continuous opportunities to learn and grow.

Ready to apply?
You can visit our Careers page to find out more about ASSA ABLOY, or submit your application by clicking ‘Apply Now’. For further information, contact Jenny Edwards, HR Advisor EMEIA.  
When you join Yale, we open doors for you
We’re trusted by millions of people every day to keep what’s important to them safe. Their home, family and belongings. Looking after our people is just as important to us.

When you join our Yale team, you’ll also be part of the ASSA ABLOY Group, the global leader in access solutions. You’ll have 50,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.

As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

Competitive salary (subject to experience) plus excellent benefits
Based: a mix of home and office working - office in Farringdon
We are an award-winning content marketing agency looking for an experienced Frontend developer to work across our portfolio of Wordpress and Drupal powered websites.
Working within our small, friendly and passionate digital department; you’ll be a part of the team responsible for the creation, ongoing development and upkeeping of our websites. Plus, you’ll have opportunity to be involved in other digital focused projects if of interest.
We're looking for someone who has...
Built, themed and run responsive sites
A good eye for detail, and a love of being thorough
Good written English and grammar
Demonstrable success coding against project timelines
A logical approach to problem-solving when things inevitably don't work, and happy to ask for help when you just can't figure out why something won't work...!
We think these technical skills are vital:
WordPress Development (ideally in Elementor)
Some experience of Drupal Twig theming, template overrides, and an understanding of developing with Drupal
Experience of CSS transpilers such as SASS, SCSS and LESS, and happy working with all four languages to create mobile-first websites
Happy writing well-structured HTML and well-documented code
Experience of Photoshop/Adobe CS
These skills would be a great bonus, too:
Experience of local development environments such as Lando, and use of Drush
Experience with theming frameworks such as Bootstrap
Ability to write and understand basic jQuery and Javascript functionality
Experience of using PHPStorm, and maybe even XDebug
Experience in an Agile development environment, and experience of using software tools such as Jira and Slack
Redactive Media Group is the UK’s leading publishing and content agency for membership organisations. We operate across a large number of consumer and business markets with clients including National Trust, the Association of Accounting Technicians and Federation of Small Businesses.
Benefits include a mix of home and office working, 25 days’ holiday, rising to 28 after 2 years’ service, subsidised gym membership, contributory pension scheme and season ticket loans and more.
We are based in Clerkenwell, London, close to the Farringdon Tube / Rail station with excellent travel connections. Our modern offices offer an exciting working space combined with a friendly company culture, informal and creative, with an emphasis on high-quality work.
If you are interested in joining our strong team, please send your CV, expected salary and cover letter outlining how your skills and abilities match our needs. Competitive salary (subject to experience) plus excellent benefits

Graduate Developer - Bracknell, BerkshireDo you want real skills and career progress, with rewards to match?Are you interested in solving hard technical challenges but with a commercial focus and customer interaction?If the answer to these questions is YES, then we would like to hear from you.OnTheMove is a software product, built using the latest technology, that allows organisations to deploy enterprise applications to mobile devices with a genuine mobile first UI. Our customers have been extremely successful with the product and we believe it has a great future in an expanding range of sub-markets.Because our products are, in essence, a toolkit from which our customers create a final configuration to deploy to users, we need the very best developers who have the intellectual rigour to think through all the ways what they are coding might be used and have the determination to build solutions that will be robust in all circumstances.After a short initial training period, you will be working on core product code to address real customer requirements. The work typically involves:building high quality solutions, often with minimal supervisiondeveloping test casessupporting our customers and internal consultants in their use of the product – typically identifying the root cause of reported problemsworking on customer implementation projects, configuring OnTheMove to the needs of particular organisations, and the configuration / support of vertical application products built in our core technologyFor the right person, there will be the opportunity to rapidly advance into areas such as design, team leadership and more customer interaction.We welcome applications from candidates who have the right to work in the UK including as Citizens, those with Settled or Pre-Settled status, and those with Student / Graduate visas. We are also able to sponsor eligible candidates under the points based system.Prior ExperienceWe are interested in people with 0 to 2 years high quality post graduation experience – although no amount of experience will act as a substitute for the critically important academic and aptitude requirements.The RewardsWe aim to recruit the very best graduates and the salary packages that we offer reflect this.When You JoinIf you join as a new or recent graduate, we start you on a basic salary of £36,500 + £1,500 car allowance. In addition, we pay a relocation allowance of up to £1,000 to people moving into the area.After 6 MonthsWithin 6 months, assuming normal progress, you should be on a package of about £46,000 comprising:a basic salary of at least £42,500a car allowance of £1,500a contribution of up to 5% of basic salary on a matching basis into your own personal pension scheme.The RequirementsIn order to apply, you need:a 2:1 or better in a numerate discipline from a reputable institution (or equivalent if you studied outside of the UK). If you have not yet graduated, you need a reasonable expectation of a suitable degree. We recruit from a wide range of backgrounds. You do not need to have a Computer Science degree – we are just as interested to hear from candidates with other numerate degrees such as Maths, Physics and Engineering.3 A levels at grade A or B in serious subjects (or equivalent if you studied outside of the UK)excellent and well-proven programming skills in a 3GL. These don’t need to be in a particular language although but we have special interest in any of the following:HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript including frameworks such as React and KnockoutObject Oriented languages in general, especially with experience of designing class models involving a high degree of abstractionC# / Javaenthusiasm, determination and a sense of “mission”relevant commercial experience, e.g. an industrial placement, is a distinct advantageOffice WorkingWe are now aiming to work 100% of the time in our Bracknell office as we believe that it is the best way to foster effective team work and increase the skills of the less experienced members of our team. A BIT ABOUT NET WORLD SPORTS
Join Net World Sports on our mission to become the world’s leading sports equipment retailer. Nothing excites us more than finding hungry, talented individuals and unleashing them in a team capable of achieving incredible things.

Our web development are at the forefront of Net World Sports, constantly researching, testing and implementing innovative solutions to offer customers the very best online experience and drive our business forwards.

You’ll be helping to implement a range of development projects and tasks, from module development to wide scale rollouts on our mobile applications. Working alongside other teams you’ll be bringing to life exciting features which will result in positive customer engagement. With all your work, you’ll ensure thorough testing is carried out on all projects to guarantee effective functionality.

You’ll help to find ways to improve our global mobile applications, ensuring that customers receive the very best shopping experience. Our new mobile application is currently being launched on Apple iOS, so you’ll gain varied experience as we look to make constant improvements, optimising the user journey each time.
We then have a number of exciting new projects that we’re looking to start this year. There’s a lot of scope for multiple avenues of development and you’ll be able to focus on areas that appeal to you.

EXPERIENCE WE'RE LOOKING FOR:
You’ll be able to produce clean and well documented code
Knowledge of iOS development, Swift and Xcode
Knowledge of web-based API integration
JavaScript development experience with one or more JS frameworks like Vue.js or React
Experience with SCSS/SASS
Mobile design pattern knowledge
Experience creating aps using android and Kotlin
GitHub, Stack Overflow
DESIRABLE:
Experience implementing payments on mobile with Apple pay/Google pay
Experience with GraphQL or in general eCommerce experience would be desirabl
WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU:
Summer and Christmas Parties - Because one party is never enough!
To be a part of a fast-growing, family business
Health & wellbeing programme
Social and charity events throughout the year
Bike to Work scheme
Employee loyalty rewards
Employee discount
An extra day off for your birthday
Additional holidays with length of service
Internal help to buy house deposit scheme

Hours: 37.5 hours per week, Monday - Friday - we offer flexible working hours which can be discussed in the interview.

With all your work, you’ll ensure thorough testing is carried out on all projects to guarantee effective functionality.

You’ll help to find ways to improve our global mobile applications, ensuring that customers receive the very best shopping experience. Our new mobile application is currently being launched on Apple iOS, so you’ll gain varied experience as we look to make constant improvements, optimising the user journey each time.
We then have a number of exciting new projects that we’re looking to start this year. There’s a lot of scope for multiple avenues of development and you’ll be able to focus on areas that appeal to you.

EXPERIENCE WE'RE LOOKING FOR:
You’ll be able to produce clean and well documented code
Knowledge of iOS development, Swift and Xcode
Knowledge of web-based API integration
JavaScript development experience with one or more JS frameworks like Vue.js or React
Experience with SCSS/SASS
Mobile design pattern knowledge
Experience creating aps using android and Kotlin
GitHub, Stack Overflow
DESIRABLE:
Experience implementing payments on mobile with Apple pay/Google pay
Experience with GraphQL or in general eCommerce experience would be desirabl

Summer and Christmas Parties - Because one party is never enough!
To be a part of a fast-growing, family business
Health & wellbeing programme
Social and charity events throughout the year
Bike to Work scheme
Employee loyalty rewards
Employee discount

Additional holidays with length of service

Brighton - UK
We are looking for a mobile app developer to join our team, working to build apps for Entertainment and Architectural Lighting control. Our apps are used by Lighting Designers all over the world to light up shows, monuments and bridges. Experience with Android or iOS development using Kotlin or Swift is essential. Suitable candidates will work with our existing small mobile app team at our office in Brighton, UK and communicate with our hardware and web developers at our offices around the world to take apps from the initial design stage all the way to App Store and Google Play submission. Part-remote working may also be possible.

Profile

Have a genuine interest in creative projects which may include lighting, sound, video and design.Excellent communication skills. Someone who is able to easily collaborate and find solutions to problems.Passionate about working as part of a small team within a small/medium sized company with a start-up spirit, taking a project from the design stage to final release.

Desired Skills and Experience

University degree or similar experience/qualification in engineering/computer science/maths.At least 2 years experience with Android/Java/Kotlin or iOS/Swift or similar mobile app development.

Why Nicolaudie?

Join a high-growth company which has established a foundation in many countries over the past 30 years and is regarded as one of the market leaders in lighting control.Our Brighton office is located in the heart of the city, 2 minutes walk from the seafront and Brighton Pier.Our products are used by DJ’s and Lighting designers all over the world.Our team members play an active role in all aspects of the development. Programming tasks may be mixed with discussions with our customers and providing input on design ideas.
Here at Nicolaudie, we manufacture a wide range of cutting edge DMX lighting control software and hardware products using the latest technologies available. We offer control products for both the Entertainment and Architectural lighting markets. Our products are used all over the world, from lighting up Tower Bridge in London to landing jets in Antarctica.

If you are interested in this role, or you believe you have something to contribute to our team, please send your CV to uk@nicolaudiegroup.com Brighton - UK

listing_jobDesc: UI Front End Developer, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, c £ 28- 32000 + benefits. Slough, Berkshire.Market leading technology company based in Slough, Berkshire are looking for a number of Frontend Developer to join their growing UI/UX Development team. You will be joining a small but growing team, focused on delivering solutions.This role will be accountable for skilfully producing software for the migration of the existing In-house application UI to a new modernised UI running under bootstrap as the primary framework. This is an excellent opportunity to get involved in developing complex systems and enhancing your skills in a fast-paced environment.Duties and responsibilities -Work with the UI/UX designer to ensure changes are implemented in accordance with the provided style guideWhere elements of the UI do not fit, within the UI style guide, work with the UI/UX designer to find solutionsCommunicate and work optimally within internal teams to ensure clear communication of technical issuesProactively investigate, potentially present options for implementing solutions and bug fixes in cooperation with development management and other internal teamsTake ownership and responsibility of components and processes within the team to make tactical and strategic changesExperience required -2+ years of development experienceFluency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, with a willingness to pick up and learn new languages and technologies as neededA full appreciation of configuration management & issue tracking management issues and systemsAptitude for UX / UI Design and an eye for detailA solid understanding of browser capabilitiesAny of the following is an advantage -Experience of Bootstrap, Foundation and/or other responsive frameworks.Systems integrationProgramming experience in .net using VB or C#Working knowledge of Cloud deployments, AWS, etc.Appreciation or experience in software or systems testingMobile/Tablet developmentThis is a great chance to join a growing company and work on a range of new and exciting projects. The role is based in Slough, Berkshire and the salary is likely to be in the range £ 28000 - 32000.
