HCI is a rapidly expanding digital health services company. We build digital platforms for the healthcare sector and have an extensive track record in making a difference to patients and the health system.We currently have a vacancy for a React Native Developer to lead on supporting and developing our award winning flagship product CONNECTPlus. CONNECTPlus is a healthcare app that helps patients manage long term health conditions and allows healthcare professionals to remotely monitor and manage patient data.We have been running this app for nearly two years and working with Exeter University on researching behavioural change modelling in our product. We are looking for a React Native developer to take the lessons we have learned and help build the next phase of CONNECTPlus from the ground up.This will be a mixed role involving feature development and maintenance of the current app, as well as taking the lead on building the next phase of CONNECTPlus - which we will start to implement towards the end of this year. This will be a greenfield development and is a fantastic opportunity to lead on a mobile healthcare project from the very initial stages through to completion.We pride ourselves on having a strong culture of collaboration and growth - so being a great communicator and being able to take ownership of a project are a must.This position is a fully remote, full-time role. Since lockdown we have made the decision to continue with home working whilst offering bi-monthly, face to face meet ups and have daily video calls with the whole team so we all stay connected.Essential skillsWe are looking for someone with 3 years experience developing apps using React Native and ideally have experience with:Android and iPhone compatibilityXcodeOnline/offline syncing (WatermelonDB a bonus!)FastlaneFirebaseTypescriptAppium or other testing softwareTestflight + PlaystoreGitScrumThe candidate: Is passionate about web and app development projects, self-motivated and organisedPossesses an enthusiastic, positive attitude and a willingness to learn.Professional and cares about best practiceHas a portfolio or evidence of own projects or previous projects worked on.Benefits: 21 days holiday plus Bank HolidaysFlexible working hoursFully Remote (UK based)Free or subsidised travelCompany events & social hoursJob Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: £60,000.00-£65,000.00 per yearBenefits:Company eventsFlexitimeWork from homeSchedule:Monday to Friday HCI is a rapidly expanding digital health services company. We build digital platforms for the healthcare sector and have an extensive track record in making a difference to patients and the health system.We currently have a vacancy for a React Native Developer to lead on supporting and developing our award winning flagship product CONNECTPlus. CONNECTPlus is a healthcare app that helps patients manage long term health conditions and allows healthcare professionals to remotely monitor and manage patient data.We have been running this app for nearly two years and working with Exeter University on researching behavioural change modelling in our product. We are looking for a React Native developer to take the lessons we have learned and help build the next phase of CONNECTPlus from the ground up.This will be a mixed role involving feature development and maintenance of the current app, as well as taking the lead on building the next phase of CONNECTPlus - which we will start to implement towards the end of this year. This will be a greenfield development and is a fantastic opportunity to lead on a mobile healthcare project from the very initial stages through to completion.We pride ourselves on having a strong culture of collaboration and growth - so being a great communicator and being able to take ownership of a project are a must.This position is a fully remote, full-time role. Since lockdown we have made the decision to continue with home working whilst offering bi-monthly, face to face meet ups and have daily video calls with the whole team so we all stay connected.Essential skillsWe are looking for someone with 3 years experience developing apps using React Native and ideally have experience with:Android and iPhone compatibilityXcodeOnline/offline syncing (WatermelonDB a bonus!)FastlaneFirebaseTypescriptAppium or other testing softwareTestflight + PlaystoreGitScrumThe candidate: Is passionate about web and app development projects, self-motivated and organisedPossesses an enthusiastic, positive attitude and a willingness to learn.Professional and cares about best practiceHas a portfolio or evidence of own projects or previous projects worked on.Benefits: 21 days holiday plus Bank HolidaysFlexible working hoursFully Remote (UK based)Free or subsidised travelCompany events & social hoursJob Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: £60,000.00-£65,000.00 per yearBenefits:Company eventsFlexitimeWork from homeSchedule:Monday to Friday Show more

What is Tred?At Tred, we’re building the UK’s leading green neo-bank. Our mission is to help people manage their money in a way that works both for them and the planet – from daily spending to long-term saving and investing, and everything in between.Imagine using a debit card that plants trees just by using it, getting instant notifications that show you where you’re spending and how it impacts the planet. Imagine getting suggestions for shops that are better for the planet than the ones you already use. Or being able to offset the carbon footprint of every transaction with the tap of a single button. Now imagine opening that account in less than 2 minutes from your phone.Tred does all of this, with lots more to come. We build all our climate tech, mobile app and banking connections in-house. We strive to make our company as green as our customers, and most importantly are building a fintech that’s better for the planetWho are we?Co-Founders, Will and Pete, are experts in using data and change management to influence outcomes and behaviours. Previous challenges have included: how do you reduce food waste in a £5.5bn supermarket? How do you ensure vulnerable citizens get food during the COVID-19 pandemic? How do you help healthy people get home from hospital quicker?With this experience, they wanted to take on the biggest problem and opportunity we face as a generation: climate change. It’s something all of us are extremely passionate about, and we’d love to meet others who are equally passionate about helping us achieve our mission.Over the past 6 months we have grown to a team of 15+ wonderful, dedicated and welcoming people.So that’s us and here’s the role: Tred has ambitious plans to deliver the new features our customers want. We’re looking for a mobile developer to join the team full-time to help drive the adoption of our Tred mobile clients. You'll play a key role in delivering these new features to our ever-growing customer-base.As a small but growing team we’ll always favour people who can bring a range of skills and experience. Our mobile clients are developed using React Native so we need someone with skills and experience of working in this way but ideally someone who knows that cross-platform technologies are not always 100% and knows how to manage this.Other skills/experience we’d like to see but are not essential:Experience in developing natively for Android / iOSTred is a fintech, so security is important to us. Experience of securing mobile applications would also be an advantageWe want our users to enjoy using our app, so you’ll be comfortable working with our product team to make our app both look and perform beautifullyWe need to be efficient so knowledge of CI/CD pipelines would be goodYou’ll be working closely with other members of the Tred team, but we are looking for someone who is confident enough to self-manage and won’t be afraid to suggest improvements and ideasYou’ll be motivated by delivering functionality for users to enjoy and useWe are not necessarily expecting to find all this experience in a candidate, but we would love to see candidates who can demonstrate the willingness and ability to learn quicklyHere’s what you’ll do in your first three months with us: Learn about the technologies that will deliver the Tred servicesImplement new screens/functions following the existing designs, using existing components, and coding standards and patternsSound good? This is what you’ll be working on in six months to a year: You'll be busy, many more features are planned across the next 12 monthsYou'll be suggesting improvements to how the client is builtYou'll be suggesting new features/designs for the Tred clientYou’ll be sharing your ideas and outputs with the Tred technology team and the wider Tred teamYou’ve read this far, now let’s see if this works for the both of us: Our head office is in Leeds city centre – about 5 minutes walk from the train station. Each week we spend 3 days in the office and 2 days working from anywhere.In addition to our positive, supportive working environment, you can expect the following benefits when working at Tred:Personal DevelopmentThe opportunity to make a tangible impact in a purpose-driven, early-stage start-upA steep learning curve and the chance to get involved with strategy, product development and much more!Responsibility from day one in a fast-paced, dynamic and autonomous working environmentCompensationCompetitive salary and generous equity options to ensure you share in the success of the business4% pension contribution as standard, all based with an ESG pension provider, no more fossil fuel pensionsCommunityWe’re a friendly team with regular company socials, come along if you want but it’s 100% optionalLooking for people to champion internal clubs. A David Attenborough fan club, vegan bake off or the Tred Twitchers - what will you start?!On the jobWe trust you to get your work done. We have 10am-4pm core hours, the rest is flexible around you or your team25 days holiday plus bank holidays, with an additional month of unpaid leave per yearSustainabilityWe lead by example so we offer a £500 ‘eco-allowance’ to help you live more sustainably. Want a new bike?! Need a KeepCup?! You choose, we payReady to make sustainability simple? £30K - £35K plus benefits (remote work, profit share scheme, private health care, personal development plan)
Three reasons why this is the role for you…
A profit share scheme and private health care shows the values of this employee-centric company.
Working with some of the world's biggest brands including; Microsoft, Xbox, Minecraftand the Premier League.
Flexible hybrid work means you only have to head into the office to see your amazingly welcoming colleagues 3 times a week in central Leeds, saving plenty of £ on that petrol that has shot up in price!
The Company
A unique Digital Agency full of web and mobile marketing specialists. A culture first approach is essential in this companies growth and direction. They have been working with Microsoft for years and have recently secured several new contracts with them, meaning that they need more hands on deck. You'll be joining a lively and collaborative Front End team of 5 who love a beer after work to discuss all things design and creative.
The Role
You will be responsible for front end development using modern development tools and frameworks including:
HTML & CSS / Sass
JavaScript - including ES6
js
Tailwind
Webpack
Web services and API integrations
You'll be writing clean code while following best practice and modular building techniques, working in cross-functional project teams to provide timely solutions to challenges and working closely with the design team to problem solve and create lean and modular interfaces. It's also important that you are able to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical people. £30K - £35K plus benefits (remote work, profit share scheme, private health care, personal development plan)

listing_jobDesc: UI Front End Developer, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, c £ 28- 32000 + benefits. Slough, Berkshire.Market leading technology company based in Slough, Berkshire are looking for a number of Frontend Developer to join their growing UI/UX Development team. You will be joining a small but growing team, focused on delivering solutions.This role will be accountable for skilfully producing software for the migration of the existing In-house application UI to a new modernised UI running under bootstrap as the primary framework. This is an excellent opportunity to get involved in developing complex systems and enhancing your skills in a fast-paced environment.Duties and responsibilities -Work with the UI/UX designer to ensure changes are implemented in accordance with the provided style guideWhere elements of the UI do not fit, within the UI style guide, work with the UI/UX designer to find solutionsCommunicate and work optimally within internal teams to ensure clear communication of technical issuesProactively investigate, potentially present options for implementing solutions and bug fixes in cooperation with development management and other internal teamsTake ownership and responsibility of components and processes within the team to make tactical and strategic changesExperience required -2+ years of development experienceFluency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, with a willingness to pick up and learn new languages and technologies as neededA full appreciation of configuration management & issue tracking management issues and systemsAptitude for UX / UI Design and an eye for detailA solid understanding of browser capabilitiesAny of the following is an advantage -Experience of Bootstrap, Foundation and/or other responsive frameworks.Systems integrationProgramming experience in .net using VB or C#Working knowledge of Cloud deployments, AWS, etc.Appreciation or experience in software or systems testingMobile/Tablet developmentThis is a great chance to join a growing company and work on a range of new and exciting projects. The role is based in Slough, Berkshire and the salary is likely to be in the range £ 28000 - 32000. Full Stack Web Developer Consultant
Location: The work location for this will include a mix of working remotely, onsite at a client or in an Accenture office or centre.
Career Level: Accenture will be recruiting at the following levels: Consultant L9
Salary and Package (dependent on experience): £55,000 - 60,000 + Excellent Benefits Package
Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services in strategy and consulting, song, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all of these services. With our thought leadership and culture of innovation, we apply industry expertise, diverse skill sets and next-generation technology to each business challenge.
We believe in inclusion and diversity and supporting the whole person. Our core values comprise of Stewardship, Best People, Client Value Creation, One Global Network, Respect for the Individual and Integrity. Year after year, Accenture is recognized worldwide not just for business performance but for inclusion and diversity too.
“Across the globe, one thing is universally true of the people of Accenture: We care deeply about what we do and the impact we have with our clients and with the communities in which we work and live. It is personal to all of us.” – Julie Sweet, Accenture CEO
With Accenture Technology you will deliver everything from point solutions for a single business function to large, long term outsourcing services, to complex systems integration installations spanning multiple businesses and functions.
We are focused on aligning IT with business priorities, enabling a digital Accenture and driving down the cost of IT, while working to provide all of our employees with the capabilities to run a high-performing business!
As a Full Stack Web Developer Consultant you will:
Participate in agile development projects
Support ongoing business requirements
Perform system and integration testing with sample and live data
Manage multiple projects at once
Collaborate on projects with minimal supervision
Perform root cause analyses and remediation for integration, system reporting and data issues
Development experience for both mobile and desktop.
Experience with building microservices
Knowledge of code versioning tools such as Git, Mercurial or SVN
Maintain quality and ensure responsiveness of applications.
Collaborate with the rest of the team to design and launch new features.
Maintain code integrity and organization.
Experience working with graphic designers and converting designs to visual elements.
Understanding and implementation of security and data protection.

We are looking for experience in the following skills:
An expert in modern web technologies, with a focus on those that customers
Demonstrable mastery in the architecture of modern web apps
Proficient with Javascript, with a focus on Next.Js and React, and an enjoyment in pushing the boundaries of the language
An expert with MACH technologies: micro-service, API-driven (GraphQL in particular), Cloud-based and Headless platforms
A familiarity with low-code solutions like Webflow for evangelising an idea
Experienced in TDD with Unit and UI Automation
The ability to quickly iterate on dynamic, UI-lead projects
A point of view on industry-leading platforms to accelerate product build cycles for our clients
Set yourself apart:
Superb attention to detail
Excellent communication skills
A passionate advocate for what’s new and upcoming
Showcase real products you’ve built
What’s it like to work inside Song Digital Product Creation:
We believe that built concepts are the best ones. We showcase value to each other and our clients by building tangible prototypes and products that speak for themselves.
We have always been people-led organisation, and would describe ourselves as a group of interesting, interested, smart, motivated and collaborative characters who care (about it all: each other, clients and of course the work).
But we don’t just talk the talk; We struck gold in the FT’s UK Leading Management Consultant Ratings for 2022: we’re unique, and we’re famous for it.
As one of Accenture Song newest and most exciting developments, we are looking for people to join this journey and continue to elevate us to the next level.
What’s in it for you
At Accenture in addition to a competitive basic salary, you will also have an extensive benefits package which includes 30 days’ vacation per year, private medical insurance and 3 extra days leave per year for charitable work of your choice!
Flexibility and mobility are required to deliver this role as there will be requirements to spend time onsite with our clients and partners to enable delivery of the first-class services we are known for.
About Accenture
Accenture Song accelerates growth and value for our clients through sustained customer relevance. Our capabilities span ideation to execution: growth, product and experience design; technology and experience platforms; creative, media and marketing strategy; and campaign, content and channel orchestration. With strong client relationships and deep industry expertise, we help our clients operate at the speed of life through the unlimited potential of imagination, technology and intelligence. Visit us at: www.accenture.com/song
Accenture is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all sections of society and does not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, or gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law.
Please note that with all of our roles, you should expect some in-person time for collaboration, learning and building relationships with clients, peers, leaders and communities.

As an employer, we will be as flexible as possible to support your specific work/life needs. Full Stack Web Developer Consultant

We are focused on aligning IT with business priorities, enabling a digital Accenture and driving down the cost of IT, while working to provide all of our employees with the capabilities to run a high-performing business!
As a Full Stack Web Developer Consultant you will:
Participate in agile development projects
Support ongoing business requirements
Perform system and integration testing with sample and live data
Manage multiple projects at once
Collaborate on projects with minimal supervision
Perform root cause analyses and remediation for integration, system reporting and data issues
Development experience for both mobile and desktop.
Experience with building microservices
Knowledge of code versioning tools such as Git, Mercurial or SVN
Maintain quality and ensure responsiveness of applications.
Collaborate with the rest of the team to design and launch new features.
Maintain code integrity and organization.
Experience working with graphic designers and converting designs to visual elements.
Understanding and implementation of security and data protection. 
As a Full Stack Web Developer Consultant you will:
Participate in agile development projects
Support ongoing business requirements
Perform system and integration testing with sample and live data
Manage multiple projects at once
Collaborate on projects with minimal supervision
Perform root cause analyses and remediation for integration, system reporting and data issues
Development experience for both mobile and desktop.

Maintain quality and ensure responsiveness of applications.
Collaborate with the rest of the team to design and launch new features.
Maintain code integrity and organization.

Understanding and implementation of security and data protection. We are looking for experience in the following skills:
An expert in modern web technologies, with a focus on those that customers
Demonstrable mastery in the architecture of modern web apps
Proficient with Javascript, with a focus on Next.Js and React, and an enjoyment in pushing the boundaries of the language
An expert with MACH technologies: micro-service, API-driven (GraphQL in particular), Cloud-based and Headless platforms
A familiarity with low-code solutions like Webflow for evangelising an idea
Experienced in TDD with Unit and UI Automation
The ability to quickly iterate on dynamic, UI-lead projects
A point of view on industry-leading platforms to accelerate product build cycles for our clients
Set yourself apart:
Superb attention to detail
Excellent communication skills
A passionate advocate for what’s new and upcoming
Showcase real products you’ve built
What’s it like to work inside Song Digital Product Creation:
We believe that built concepts are the best ones. We showcase value to each other and our clients by building tangible prototypes and products that speak for themselves.
We have always been people-led organisation, and would describe ourselves as a group of interesting, interested, smart, motivated and collaborative characters who care (about it all: each other, clients and of course the work).
But we don’t just talk the talk; We struck gold in the FT’s UK Leading Management Consultant Ratings for 2022: we’re unique, and we’re famous for it.
As one of Accenture Song newest and most exciting developments, we are looking for people to join this journey and continue to elevate us to the next level.
What’s in it for you
At Accenture in addition to a competitive basic salary, you will also have an extensive benefits package which includes 30 days’ vacation per year, private medical insurance and 3 extra days leave per year for charitable work of your choice!
Flexibility and mobility are required to deliver this role as there will be requirements to spend time onsite with our clients and partners to enable delivery of the first-class services we are known for.
About Accenture
Accenture Song accelerates growth and value for our clients through sustained customer relevance. Our capabilities span ideation to execution: growth, product and experience design; technology and experience platforms; creative, media and marketing strategy; and campaign, content and channel orchestration. With strong client relationships and deep industry expertise, we help our clients operate at the speed of life through the unlimited potential of imagination, technology and intelligence. Visit us at: www.accenture.com/song
Accenture is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all sections of society and does not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, or gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law.
Please note that with all of our roles, you should expect some in-person time for collaboration, learning and building relationships with clients, peers, leaders and communities.

Junior Game Developer

Switch Studios in Ipswich is an established developer of high-quality casino table games for online and mobile platforms and we are working with some of the biggest players in the gambling industry. As part of Switch Studios, you will be working for one of the foremost providers of gaming technology in the world.
The Role

We are looking for a Junior Game Developer with a passion for learning, an inquisitive mind and the ability to apply themselves to latest technologies. It’s an exciting time for someone to join a progressive company and accelerate their career!
You will work closely with a variety of team members, including Designers, Artists and Senior Developers, to develop and improve online games for multiple desktop, mobile and tablet platforms.

What do we look for?

We are looking for an individual who has personal drive, is self-motivated, hard-working, with a flexible, can-do attitude.
Enthusiastic to learn and continuously develop their skill set.
Needs to have a genuine passion for technology.
Has an analytical and intuitive mind, be a creative thinker.
Good problem-solving skills.
Great attention to detail.
Key technical Skills:

Good working knowledge of Typescript, C#, Java, or any conceptually similar language
Demonstrable understanding of programming fundamentals and common design patterns
Experience with source control software, preferably git
A strong academic background (formal qualification, HND, Degree or equivalent)
Ability to collaborate in small teams
Some experience with HTML, CSS or other web technologies would be beneficial
Some familiarity with contemporary web trends and technologies would be beneficial
Some knowledge of Agile methodologies would be beneficial
Some professional experience would be beneficial

What we offer:

We understand that having a healthy work-life balance is essential and in return for your dedication, we offer multiple benefits to suit your needs including flexible working hours, free health insurance, free gym membership, daily lunch allowance, pension scheme with company contributions starting from your first payslip, 25 days a holiday per year, social events and much more. As a Mobile Developer, you will be involved in implementing functionality to new and existing applications, working with designers to create beautifully designed and well-considered user experiences, as well as thoroughly testing your work through unit testing and device testing. Working to our dev-ops methodology you will be involved in backlog estimations, and specification and code review.

This is an opportunity to grow and thrive in one of the UK’s leading practices for digital innovation, design and development. You’ll collaborate with teams in a fast-paced environment to develop user-friendly mobile applications. If that sounds interesting to you, we’d love to learn more about you.

What You’ll Do
Developing fully functional native and cross-platform mobile applications
Keeping up to date with mobile development techniques and methodologies
Working to achieve team goals and continuous improvements
Be involved in the entire product application lifecycle (concept, design, test, release and post release)
Testing work to ensure specifications and quality
Troubleshoot and debug to optimize user experience and performance
Ensure new and legacy applications meet quality standards.
Required Skills and Experience
Proven work experience as a Mobile developer
Demonstrable portfolio of released applications
2 or more years’ experience, developing iOS or Android applications using modern approaches
A solid knowledge of object orientated programming
Experience of software testing techniques
Excellent analytical skills with a good problem-solving attitude
Ability to pick up and learn new technologies quickly

If you are unsure if you meet the specific requirements of this role, please still apply as we have several roles available and will shape roles to fit an individual’s capabilities.

Helpful Skills and Experience
Knowledge of cross-platform frameworks like Xamarin and Flutter
Experience developing for platforms such as UWP, Windows, Mac, etc.
Able to bring your best to the team culture and happiness
Qualifications
University Degree (2:1 or above) in a related subject or similar experience/qualifications.
Salary
Full time – permanent
Competitive salary and benefits based on your experience
Benefits
Up to 33 days of holidays (inc. 8 bank holidays)
Personal research & development budget
Flexible working
Work from home opportunities
Childcare vouchers
Excellent work/life balance
Vibrant and innovative culture
Company events and social hours

This is an excellent and varied role in which initiative, teamwork, and a thirst for improvement are well rewarded.

Our hiring process
Introductory video call – informal and informative; a great opportunity to discover who we are, what we do and how we do it.
Code test – specific, relevant and not too long; we use this as a platform for discussion at your interview.
Interview – discussing your code, your experience and an in-depth discussion on the role and what you can achieve in it.
Useful alongside your CV when applying
Times that work to speak to you. Everything is on MS Teams at the moment and we will try and be flexible to suit.
Details of any particularly cool projects that you are proud of, and links to any public code repositories to us via the link below.
A cover letter – if you want to tell us a bit more about you and why you’re interested in Screenmedia, we would love to read it.
Let's talk!

Apply via the link below.

Enterprise Applications
Location: Egham

Salary: £37,467 per annum - including London Allowance

Post Type: Full Time

Closing Date: 23.59 hours BST on Wednesday 31 August 2022

Reference: 0822-378

Full-Time, Permanent
Applications are invited for the post of Web & Application Developer in the IT Department.
This post will work across both the Student Administrative Systems Team and the Web & Mobile Apps team helping to design and implement elegant and compelling web-based experiences that enable colleagues and students to interact with the University’s digital services.
The post holder will continue their personal development journey at Royal Holloway by assisting with the design of interactive prototypes, participate in the daily scrums and help turn the prototypes into working solutions using a wide range of front-end and back end technologies such as HTML5, Angular JS, Bootstrap, Sass, MS Graph and other vendor / platform specific APIs and workflow solutions.
There are plenty of training opportunities as the post holder will have opportunities to be engaged in developing across the Microsoft Power platform and within a new MS Dynamics implementation. There is access to Microsoft subscriptions, a Pluralsight licence and knowledge from seasoned team members.
In order to be considered for this role, a passion for web and application development is a must have, along with knowledge of programming using a language such as JavaScript, C#, Python or Java.
Prior experience of building websites / applications using HTML5, CSS 3 and JavaScript is essential, either at an academic level or in industry, and whilst education to degree level or equivalent is beneficial, a demonstrable portfolio of projects or completion of industry relevant course would be an acceptable alternative.
Knowledge of Angular JS or a server side language such as ASP.Net or PHP or of the Microsoft Power platform and Graph APIs is desirable but not essential as training can be provided if necessary.
The successful candidate will also possess excellent attention to detail as they will be creating elements for use on the public website and business critical services, they will have clear written and verbal communications skills and will be able to demonstrate a logical approach to problem solving.
In return we offer a highly competitive rewards and benefits package including generous annual leave and training and development opportunities. The post is based in Egham, Surrey where the College is situated in a beautiful, leafy campus near to Windsor Great Park and within commuting distance from London.
To view further details of this post and to apply please visit https://jobs.royalholloway.ac.uk. For queries on the application process the Human Resources Department can be contacted by email at: recruitment@rhul.ac.uk.
The College is unable to obtain permission to work in the UK for this post. Therefore all applicants must be able to demonstrate their right to work in the UK if they wish to apply.
To view further details of this post and to apply please visit https://jobs.royalholloway.ac.uk. For queries on the application process the Human Resources Department can be contacted by email at: recruitment@rhul.ac.uk
Please quote the reference: 0822-378
Closing Date: 23:59, 31 August 2022
Interview Date: TBC
Further details: Job Description Person Specification

Email details to a friend
Apply Online

The university has adopted hybrid working for some roles therefore some remote working may be possible for this role.

Location: Egham

Salary: £37,467 per annum - including London Allowance

Post Type: Full Time

Closing Date: 23.59 hours BST on Wednesday 31 August 2022

Reference: 0822-378

Full-Time, Permanent
Applications are invited for the post of Web & Application Developer in the IT Department.
This post will work across both the Student Administrative Systems Team and the Web & Mobile Apps team helping to design and implement elegant and compelling web-based experiences that enable colleagues and students to interact with the University’s digital services.
The post holder will continue their personal development journey at Royal Holloway by assisting with the design of interactive prototypes, participate in the daily scrums and help turn the prototypes into working solutions using a wide range of front-end and back end technologies such as HTML5, Angular JS, Bootstrap, Sass, MS Graph and other vendor / platform specific APIs and workflow solutions.
There are plenty of training opportunities as the post holder will have opportunities to be engaged in developing across the Microsoft Power platform and within a new MS Dynamics implementation. There is access to Microsoft subscriptions, a Pluralsight licence and knowledge from seasoned team members.
In order to be considered for this role, a passion for web and application development is a must have, along with knowledge of programming using a language such as JavaScript, C#, Python or Java.
Prior experience of building websites / applications using HTML5, CSS 3 and JavaScript is essential, either at an academic level or in industry, and whilst education to degree level or equivalent is beneficial, a demonstrable portfolio of projects or completion of industry relevant course would be an acceptable alternative.
Knowledge of Angular JS or a server side language such as ASP.Net or PHP or of the Microsoft Power platform and Graph APIs is desirable but not essential as training can be provided if necessary.
The successful candidate will also possess excellent attention to detail as they will be creating elements for use on the public website and business critical services, they will have clear written and verbal communications skills and will be able to demonstrate a logical approach to problem solving.
In return we offer a highly competitive rewards and benefits package including generous annual leave and training and development opportunities. The post is based in Egham, Surrey where the College is situated in a beautiful, leafy campus near to Windsor Great Park and within commuting distance from London.
To view further details of this post and to apply please visit https://jobs.royalholloway.ac.uk. For queries on the application process the Human Resources Department can be contacted by email at: recruitment@rhul.ac.uk.
The College is unable to obtain permission to work in the UK for this post. Therefore all applicants must be able to demonstrate their right to work in the UK if they wish to apply.

This is a remote role in which you would be expected in our clients London office ideally once a month but they are open to once a quarter for team events (travel costs covered)
We are working with the leading advice forum in the UK who are on the hunt for a new passionate PHP Developer. This is a huge platform with over 25 million hits per week and 85 million forum posts already on their site, at peak times they see a new post every half a second and 700 requests a minute so they have some super interesting and impressive architecture in place!
You will be joining a tech team of 8 work on a range of greenfield projects such as site enhancements, a new mobile app, new video platform and not to mention they just acquired a social media business for parents and have a ton of exciting plans to integrate that with their platform.
You can expect to work in a friendly team where everyone's opinion is valued and you will tons of opportunity to learn new skills and progress.
You will have experience working on large products at scale.

The ideal skills for the Lead Developer are below:PHPTALL Stack (Tailwind, Alpine JS, Laravel and Livewire)TDD experience and passion for clean code.Experience of code reviews and working in an agile environmentMySQLGit
In return you can expect a salary of £70,000-£80,000 DOE
You also received a Pension, 25 days holiday plus bank holidays, flexible working, bonus scheme, Perkbox subscription and a new M1 Macbook Air with subscriptions to Laracasts, LinkedIn Learning, Treehouse etc.

Frontend Developer
Job details
Posted 08 July 2022
Salary £55000 - £60000 per annum
LocationLondon
Job type Permanent
DisciplineDevelopment
ReferenceAD-9
Contact NameAna Da Silva
Job description
If you’re looking for a challenge and working on a range of exciting projects then this could be the role for you!

Our client is a young development agency offering bespoke software products. They work with small start-ups to help bring their ideas to life, grow their products, and help raise investment. They dream BIG - working on a range of products including single-page applications, static websites, and mobile apps.

Role: Frontend Developer
Location: Fully Remote
Salary: Up to £60,000
Benefits: 25 days holiday + bank holidays, Flexi working hours, regular team meals + more

They are looking for a great JavaScript developer who is proficient with React.js. Your primary focus will be on developing user interface components and implementing them following well-known React.js workflows (such as Flux or Redux). You ideally will have worked with React for several years in a commercial capacity, whilst training and on-the-job experience will be given, they are expecting somebody to come on board and hit the ground running within their first week!!

Job Responsibilities:

Developing new user-facing features using React.js
Building reusable components and front-end libraries for future use
Unit testing frontend code and components
Using tools like StoryBook for component documentation
Translating designs and wireframes into high-quality code
Optimizing components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers
Working alongside backend engineers to connect RESTful API endpoints

Must-Have Skills:

Strong proficiency in HTML and CSS
Strong proficiency in JavaScript, including DOM manipulation and the JavaScript object model
Thorough understanding of React.js and its core principles
Experience with popular state management (such as Flux or Redux)
Familiarity with newer specifications of EcmaScript
Familiarity with RESTful APIs
Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirements
Familiarity with Git
Familiarity with Next.js

Nice-to-Haves (But not necessary)

Multi-project experience (Agency)
Familiarity with SASS
Familiarity with React Native
Experience with Project Management tools (such as Jira)
Experience in Agile methodologies
Worked in start-ups
If you would like to be considered for this position, please apply with your CV. We will be in touch if your skills match the role. Frontend Developer

Mobile Developer / Fully Remote / London
An exciting AI start up in the educational and media industry is looking for Mobile Developers to join their growing team. Paying up to £80k per annum you will be working remotely or from their London based office. They are now growing their inhouse software development team as they look to launch their exciting new app.
Your role will be to contribute to day to day greenfield development and will therefore be a big part of the success of the project. You will rapidly learn new skills and help shape the culture of a new team.
Key Skills:
Extensive software engineering experience
Mobile development, iOS and Android, flutter nice to have
Azure
Experience in c# or python is nice to have
understanding of agile product development and devops
experience working for a startup (not essential)
Good communication skills and able to work with key stakeholders
If you think you have the key skills and experience, then please apply now!

ABOUT JOURNEYJourney is a team of digital specialists based in Auckland, London, India and the Philippines.We create transformational digital experiences that build loyalty, drive sales, and deliver insight. Through a blend of consulting, design and development, we provide clients with strategic digital products, platforms, bespoke software, mobile apps and enterprise websites.We love what we do, and we do it well. We’ve won many awards for our work over the last few years and have expanded internationally, too – with a studio opening in London to support our clients in EMEA.We look after each other and have fun together. Our goal is to make Journey the place where you can do the best work of your career and enjoy yourself at the same time.OUR VALUESKnow the why.Be a radiator.Be prepared.Never settle.ABOUT THE ROLEAs a critical member of our team you’ll apply your impressive front-end skills to develop and deliver solutions for a variety of online projects. You’ll work directly with some great local and international companies as an architect, engineer and builder of tools that enable our clients to change and grow.Level: Experienced intermediate to senior.Ideal start date: Mid-September to early October.WHAT YOU’LL BE DOINGWeb-based and React Native development. The React Native work will be supporting an existing code base.Project planning.Software design and architecture.Writing clean, maintainable code based on SOLID principles.Reviewing pull requests.Bug fixing and support work.Testing your own work.Involvement in process improvement.Liaising with the design and development teams to ensure understanding of the initial feature requirements.Reviewing new features and improvements against their original requirements, including having an awareness of the interconnectedness of different functions within the product, and testing other relevant and related functions.Being able to lead technical solutions using your extensive experience and identifying opportunities for improvement.YOU WILLYou need to be a highly-motivated, organised and passionate person with a keen eye for detail.You’ll be willing to tackle demanding tasks and take responsibility for actions, using your initiative to make suggestions and work to make things happen.You have a curious and driven nature, always wanting to keep up-to-date with coding and technological trends.You’ll have a strong desire to learn and to share your knowledge with your team. In addition, you’ll be flexible enough to adapt your approach to different team members, helping to motivate and inspire with a positive attitude.You must excel at managing delivery, with a keen ability to define team and project objectives including expectations and deadlines and monitor the progress of your projects against targets.You will use your strong oral and written communication skills to build rapport with internal and external stakeholders on your projects. You will be a good listener, but also highly-persuasive, using facts, clear arguments and personal conviction to influence and persuade others.Essential skills and experience: JavaScript, HTML, SCSS and CSS.Experience in at least one front-end framework: React, Vue or similar.Experience with React Native and XCode.Managing multiple projects in a fast-paced, time-sensitive, results-oriented, web/mobile-based development environment and an understanding of what's required to get the job done.The entire lifecycle of digital development from Information Architecture to prototyping, to user testing to internal testing and bug-fixing.Ideal skills and experience: Complex front-end development.Experience in integrating with ASP.NET.Writing and executing unit and integration testing.OO design patterns and SOLID design principles.Software design and architecture.Jira/Confluence.Webpack.BENEFITSCompetitive salary.25 days’ holiday per year.Pension, with 3% contribution.Flexible working.Regular team socials and activities.A highly-supportive, people-oriented culture and working environment.Being an early part of Journey’s growth journey in EMEA.APPLY FOR THIS ROLETo apply you can visit jobs.journey-digital.com. Job Summary

We are looking for a Web and Applications Developer to provide technical expertise and resource to support and develop web services and applications within the University.

As part of this role you will participate in the support of existing services, development of application software using appropriate current technologies and programming languages, as well as providing internal support for third-party applications, as well as receiving and resolving reported faults with the University’s application development and web environment.

You will provide technical expertise and resource to participate directly in the planning and delivery of web/application development and delivery projects, which may be related to expansion, upgrading or rationalisation or associated with developments within the University.

You should hold a First Degree in a relevant subject as well as having significant knowledge and experience of developing applications for the web including an understanding of Object Oriented coding concepts and techniques. A strong understanding of one or more leading web application technologies is also essential.

Salary on first appointment is normally to the bottom of the scale, although in exceptional circumstances an appointment further up the scale may be considered.

The advertised salary includes a market supplement of £7,761 per annum (pro rata). This supplement is reviewed biennially and may be amended or withdrawn in line with agreed University pay policies.

Relocation assistance is available for this role, subject to conditions.

To apply, please submit your CV along with a covering letter detailing your suitability for the post as set out in the person specification.

Interview date: 6 October 2022


Job Description

RESPONSIBLE TO: Web and Applications Team Lead

RESPONSIBLE FOR: No Supervisory Responsibility

PURPOSE OF POST: To provide technical expertise and resource to support and develop web service and applications within the University.

PRINCIPAL DUTIES:

To participate in the development and support in-house and third-party application software using appropriate current technologies.

To maintain an awareness of current and emerging technologies and methodologies across the application development lifecycle and how they could be applied within the University environment.

To receive and resolve reported faults with the University’s application development and Web environment.

To work with the Web and Application Team Leader and Senior Web and Applications Developer to contribute to the analysis of reported faults, to contribute to the development of Web and application monitoring procedures and to contribute to the analysis of these systems.

To provide technical expertise and resource to participate directly in the planning and delivery of web/ application development projects, which may be related to expansion, upgrading or rationalisation or associated with developments within the University.

To participate and assist in the definition of detailed technical standards for web / application developments working under the guidance of the Lead Web Applications Developer.

To participate and assist in the definition of a comprehensive set of procedures through which the operating performance and capacity utilisation of the IT Web Infrastructure can be monitored either automatically or by junior technical staff.

To assist the Web & Application Team Leader and Senior Web & Applications Developer in the analysis of the Web / Applications performance measures and to use these measures along with an understanding of technology trends, the University’s IT Strategy and user growth projections to contribute to forward Web / Applications Infrastructure design and planning.

To ensure work is delivered in accordance to the current IT security and quality standards and procedures, and as technical resource to directly contribute to the ongoing development of these standards and procedures.

To ensure that all relevant documentation is maintained to reflect ongoing changes to the University’s development environment.

To share and disseminate information and understanding about different technologies and systems across the web development team, through one-to-one meetings or team workshops.

To act as a mentor to colleagues, developing their technical expertise and understanding.

Ensure that staff work to agreed health and safety systems of work. Carry out risk assessments and audits as required.

Person Specification

ESSENTIAL REQUIREMENTS

Qualifications and Professional Memberships

First Degree or for exceptional candidates, significant working experience and a demonstrable track record will be accepted as an alternative.

Knowledge

Strong understanding of PHP and one or more leading web application technologies such as ASP.NET, C# or Coldfusion, and their associated technologies such as HTML, CSS, Javascript and XML, and development frameworks. Good understanding of Object Oriented coding concepts and techniques

Understanding of working in a development team, with Integrated development environments and Source Control systems, such as Subversion (SVN) or GIT.

Demonstration of positive self-motivated attitude towards learning and development.

Experience

Significant knowledge and experience of developing applications for the web, through design to implementation.


DESIRABLE REQUIREMENTS

Qualifications and Professional Memberships

Other Professional Qualifications in programming or associated technologies.

Knowledge

Knowledge of the Sharepoint Online would be advantageous.

Familiar with concepts of Agile development methodology, including sprints/iterations, scrums etc.

Familiar with concepts of Unit Testing and Test Driven Development.

An understanding of working with mobile platforms.

Experience

Working experience of Windows Operating Systems. Working experience of Linux Operating Systems.

Experience providing application development and support services in an environment servicing 500+ users.

Experience of mixed server operating systems, including Windows NT/2000/2003/XP, Netware and Unix/Linux.

Experience of working within the context of formally defined and managed implementation projects, working to strict deadlines, deliverables and objectives.


Unsociable Hours

May be required to work additional hours from time to time, particularly during major upgrades / implementations and in the case of service incidents.

Travel

Travel within the UK to other institutions or suppliers from time to time.

Behaviours

Behaviour 1: Communication - Ability to receive, understand and convey information requiring careful explanation and information of a complex or conceptual nature, in a clear and accurate manner.

Behaviour 2: Service Delivery - Experience of exploring and adapting a service to meet customers expectations and also identifying ways of improving standards.

Behaviour 3: Initiative and Problem Solving - Experience of using initiative and creativity to resolve problems, identifying practical and suitable solutions.

Behaviour 4: Planning and Organising Resources - Experience of planning, prioritising and organising your own work or resources to achieve agreed objectives.

Behaviour 5: Team Development - Experience of: providing advice or guidance to new starts; delivering training or instruction to others on specific tasks or activities. Job Summary

Qualifications and Professional Memberships

Other Professional Qualifications in programming or associated technologies.

Knowledge

Knowledge of the Sharepoint Online would be advantageous.

Familiar with concepts of Agile development methodology, including sprints/iterations, scrums etc.

Familiar with concepts of Unit Testing and Test Driven Development.

An understanding of working with mobile platforms.

Experience

Working experience of Windows Operating Systems. Working experience of Linux Operating Systems.

Experience providing application development and support services in an environment servicing 500+ users.

Experience of mixed server operating systems, including Windows NT/2000/2003/XP, Netware and Unix/Linux.

Experience of working within the context of formally defined and managed implementation projects, working to strict deadlines, deliverables and objectives.


Unsociable Hours

May be required to work additional hours from time to time, particularly during major upgrades / implementations and in the case of service incidents.

Travel

Travel within the UK to other institutions or suppliers from time to time.

Behaviours

Behaviour 1: Communication - Ability to receive, understand and convey information requiring careful explanation and information of a complex or conceptual nature, in a clear and accurate manner.

Behaviour 2: Service Delivery - Experience of exploring and adapting a service to meet customers expectations and also identifying ways of improving standards.

Behaviour 3: Initiative and Problem Solving - Experience of using initiative and creativity to resolve problems, identifying practical and suitable solutions.

Behaviour 4: Planning and Organising Resources - Experience of planning, prioritising and organising your own work or resources to achieve agreed objectives.

Behaviour 5: Team Development - Experience of: providing advice or guidance to new starts; delivering training or instruction to others on specific tasks or activities. Show more

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a highly talented, creative and friendly team working within a converted barn on a varied range of exciting websites and digital projects.
You will have a passion for coding and new technologies with a portfolio of sites / projects that clearly demonstrate your skills and capabilities.
What will you be responsible for:
Developing websites and web applications which are optimised across multiple browsers and device platforms
Working across a broad range of exciting projects for different clients and big brands
Helping to recommend, plan and develop dynamic web and digital projects
Being actively involved at all stages of the design and development process
Working closely with the UX, design, SEO and project management teams
Testing and supporting new and existing solutions
Staying up-to-date with current web trends and new technologies and have a desire to push the boundaries.
Working in a variety of development processes, including Agile
What it takes to be successful:
Experience with Drupal
Advanced knowledge of PHP and MySQL including modern PHP frameworks such as Symfony and Laravel
Excellent HTML5 / CSS3 hand-coding skills combined with Ajax, JQuery and Javascript libraries and tools (Vue.JS, React, Sass)
Experience working with Node.JS/Express
Skilled in Object Oriented Programming and Design Patterns
Extensive experience of developing and testing responsive websites for multiple browsers, platforms and devices
Proficient in Linux administration, Apache configuration and MySQL database design
Experience of using version control systems – ideally Git
Good working knowledge of web and mobile UX/UI best practices
A good understanding of accessibility standard
An organised approach with excellent attention to detail and a pride in your work
The ability to work to tight deadlines whilst providing clients and colleagues with exceptional service at all times

Experience of automated testing (for example PhpUnit, Behat or Selenium) and automated deployment and continuous integration (Travis, Jenkins)
Good understanding of testing methodologies and procedures
Experience and/or knowledge of Agile software development methodologies

Moving house is stressful.Don’t take our word for it. Google “life’s most stressful events”, and you’ll see moving is on nearly every list.But moving into your new home should be exciting.Curating Pinterest boards, buying house plants, picking out furniture. That’s what moving should be about.That’s why we’ve made it our mission to transform the Property Industry. People moving home regularly cite a lack of transparency and a painfully slow process, and that’s often due to the technology in Estate Agent’s hands.For the past five years, we’ve been working hard to change that.Behind the very best SaaS companies are teams of talented, highly driven people, and that’s exactly the kind of team you can expect to join at Street Group.If you love autonomy, are naturally curious, and want to have a genuine impact within a growing company, we think you’d fit right in.*The Street Mobile team*Over the past 18 months, the Mobile team have been busy building a B2B app used by estate agents across the UK to manage property viewings. Over the next 12 months, the focus is to build a B2C app that will transform the way people move house in the UK: from buyers and sellers to landlords and tenants.This is where you come in - you'll help shape our apps and really leave your mark; making the property industry a better place for everyone.Here’s what you can expect to be working on as a Mobile Developer at Street Group:Working closely with our Senior Mobile Developer, Product Owner and UI/UX Designer to build the best mobile apps for our customersA heavy focus on building the brand new consumer-facing app, with some new feature/update work on the B2B app as and when required.Getting involved in making decisions for the mobile roadmapCollaborating with other Street teams; e.g. the wider development team & Customer Success teams, to ensure feature requests and bugs get actioned quickly.Who we're looking forYou have some commercial experience with React Native (or have a background in React and would like to transition your skills to mobile products)You’ve worked with Redux before on commercial projectsYou love collaborating with other developers, POs, UX teams, and commercial teams (e.g. customer success)Bonus points if you have any experience with (or an interest in) PHP, Laravel, or UI/UXResearch has shown that women tend to rule themselves out of applying for jobs unless they meet 100% of the requirements. If you fall into that category and were about to rule yourself out based on the above criteria; please consider applying anyway. We'd love to see your application!Why join Street Group?Every member of the team shares in the success of the business with Share OptionsHybrid-working - you can work from home up to 4 days per week️ Guilt-Free R&R - £1000 towards a holiday after your first year with the team (we'll even cover the tax!)Joining a culture that supports your development and encourages growth£500 yearly L&D budget for your career developmentYour birthday on us - we pay, you stay away‘Give something back’ - 2 paid days volunteering on usFlexible working hoursJoining a new team in an exciting business with huge ambitionBe a part of something bigger - everyone in our team is passionate about improving the entire property industry! It's a huge goal, but it motivates us to do better every single day.Fully stocked fridge and beers (or an alternative) on us every Friday afternoonMonthly mental health coaching with SanctusCompany and team off-sites, events and happy hours (even while remote!)‍ A chance to work on cutting edge technologyCycle to work schemeComfortable, relaxed office space for when we're out of lockdown - office dogs welcome!Feel good about sustainability - we're a climate-positive company!Regular wellbeing initiativesSalary£40k - £55k dependent on experience. However, sometimes the perfect person is far more or less experienced than we anticipated. In these situations planned ranges go out the window. If you think that might be the case, please apply and just let us know.We care deeply about helping the tech industry become a more inclusive and diverse place and we work hard to lead by example. We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity through attracting and retaining a complementary team of employees and building an inclusive environment for all. About the role
We work with visionary clients to invent new ways of engaging people with games, interactive and playful products. Every day our teams work collaboratively with high profile entrepreneurs, big name brands and the world’s most respected institutions.

Now we’re looking for a Unity games developer to join our studio working on games and highly interactive experiences for entertainment and education.

Note that we predominantly target web and mobile platforms.

This is a remote working position and is open to anyone currently based within the UK.
Strengths
Passion for new and emerging tech
Experience of full commercial project lifecycle – from concept to launch and beyond
An appreciation of games and interactive design
Excellent communication and team skills – note we are a fully remote team
Skills
Unity 2D and 3D games programming in C#
iOS/Android and browser targets
Git version control

Bonus points for:

Shader experience
WebGL
Web tech experience – PHP, MySQL etc
Server setup – especially AWS
Experience integrating third party advertising and purchasing APIs
How to apply
To apply for this role please submit your CV and provide examples of your work.

Please note, to qualify you must provide live links to examples of your work.

This is a remote working position open to anyone based in the UK. At the moment we are not considering applications from candidates who are based outside of the UK.

Getting back to you

We carefully review each application, but unfortunately we’re not able to get back to everyone individually. If we’d like to progress with your application we’ll be in touch with you within two weeks.

If you’re from a recruitment agency we won’t be taking things any further. Direct candidates only please. About the role

Company Summary
Product Madness is one of the world's largest mobile game studios, with a global presence. Founded in 2007, we’re today a top-grossing leader in social casino mobile games that are crafted with passion and commitment. Our ambition is to entertain millions of players around the world with our remarkable titles that include Heart of Vegas, Cashman Casino, Lighting Link and FaFaFa™ Gold.
We are Mad about games and the way they bring people together, and that passion and culture is what holds us together as a studio, connects us with the partners we collaborate with, and is what links us to our sister studios across the world.
Job Posting Title
Mobile Lead Developer
Summary
We are currently looking to hire a Lead Developer with mobile experience to join our Core Technologies team. You will be leading a group of core developers to help build our game portfolio, supporting tools and technologies. The ideal candidate will have solid technical background as a software engineer, delivery of mobile apps, SDKs and libraries experience, passion for leading, mentoring, coaching team members. As a Team Pod lead, you will work closely with the other teams (Pods), Software Architect, Engineering Manager and our Product team to drive engineering excellence for a global engineering team to support high performance using agile methodologies.

Your team(Pod) is a part of a department which is responsible for building and maintaining the core infrastructure software of mobile games within a matrix organization. Each development team is part of a business unit with a certain level of autonomy to drive innovation and engage their player base.

This is a role that will suit a solid software engineer who will help and guide the team for the delivery goals, ensure the best practices and principles applied, mentor and coach engineers so they grow in their careers, and have a focus on great people and cross team practices.
What You'll Do
Requirements
Experience in native mobile development, or proficiency, in either Objective C, Swift Java, Kotlin.
In-depth knowledge of software engineering principles and design, SOLID and OOP.
Experience with mobile platforms ,operating systems and infrastructure
Experience in building flexible and reusable systems
Highly experienced with automated testing
Proficient with CI and SCM
Exemplary communication skills
Team leading experience is a plus
What We're Looking For
Responsibilities
Design and build core infrastructure software for the mobile platforms.
Collaborate with a team of developers, Technical Product Owner, Project Manager and Software Architect to define, design, and ship new features or improvements.
Be responsible for the delivery of your team, ensure that developers have what they need to do the team’s work.
Work with other teams (pods), facilitate collaboration and cross-team knowledge sharing.
Work with outside data sources and APIs.
Unit-test code for robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliability
Work on bug fixing and improving application performance
Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies, patterns, libraries etc. to maximise development efficiency
Conduct Code Reviews for the tasks finished by the team members.
Provide leadership, management, coaching and mentoring for the team.
Stimulate hiring, training, performance reviews and careers plans for team members.
Why Product Madness?
Product Madness is so much more than just a Pool table and a foosball game.
We believe in an honest and transparent approach with our teammates. Company wide weekly Town Halls, All Hands and strategy meetings are just a few ways in which we encourage an open and honest path to achieving complete transparency.
Despite a pandemic, there isn’t a day where we don’t feel connected to one another.
With frequent events, workshops, giveaways, slack coffee and donut sessions we have definitely brought on our office culture to this new virtual world of zoom calls.
We also try to cater for all our staff’s needs – be that a freshly brewed cappuccino made by our professional barista in our free coffee shop or by providing a bountiful supply of tasty snacks to keep us refueled and buzzing.
We love to organise plenty of social get-togethers and action-packed activity days, be it slipping inside an inflatable bumper ball for a mad session of football zorbing or throwing caution to the wind and traversing giddy treetop rope courses at Go Ape. On top of these team-building activities, our lunch and learn workshops, not to mention the lavish Christmas and summer parties, foster that ‘work hard, play hard’ mantra. Our offices are based in the heart of the metropolises of London and Lviv, surrounded by an abundance of diversity and inspiration to keep those ideas flowing.
Our Values
People First
We have the deepest respect for our people and their well being. We know they are exceptionally talented and will always have a choice. We want them to re-choose us every day. We are committed to building a culture where each person's voice will always be heard and addressed.
MAD for More
Always improving, innovating and never settling for the existing. We push all boundaries with courage and ambition to become the world’s best games company.
Champion Together

We excel at what we do but yet remain humble and helpful to our teammates. We champion one another and hold each other to high standards without any egos.
Globally Inclusive
We are all Equal - regardless of the language we speak, where we live, our gender, religion or culture we come from. We want to build a global home, where everyone has the equal opportunity to make an impact.
Customer Focused
We always think from the customer's perspective - be it players or internal customers.
Improving their experience and joy is what drives us. Every client's success is our big win! Company Summary
Product Madness is one of the world's largest mobile game studios, with a global presence. Founded in 2007, we’re today a top-grossing leader in social casino mobile games that are crafted with passion and commitment. Our ambition is to entertain millions of players around the world with our remarkable titles that include Heart of Vegas, Cashman Casino, Lighting Link and FaFaFa™ Gold.
We are Mad about games and the way they bring people together, and that passion and culture is what holds us together as a studio, connects us with the partners we collaborate with, and is what links us to our sister studios across the world.
Job Posting Title
Mobile Lead Developer
Summary
We are currently looking to hire a Lead Developer with mobile experience to join our Core Technologies team. You will be leading a group of core developers to help build our game portfolio, supporting tools and technologies. The ideal candidate will have solid technical background as a software engineer, delivery of mobile apps, SDKs and libraries experience, passion for leading, mentoring, coaching team members. As a Team Pod lead, you will work closely with the other teams (Pods), Software Architect, Engineering Manager and our Product team to drive engineering excellence for a global engineering team to support high performance using agile methodologies.

Your team(Pod) is a part of a department which is responsible for building and maintaining the core infrastructure software of mobile games within a matrix organization. Each development team is part of a business unit with a certain level of autonomy to drive innovation and engage their player base.

This is a role that will suit a solid software engineer who will help and guide the team for the delivery goals, ensure the best practices and principles applied, mentor and coach engineers so they grow in their careers, and have a focus on great people and cross team practices.
What You'll Do
Requirements
Experience in native mobile development, or proficiency, in either Objective C, Swift Java, Kotlin.
In-depth knowledge of software engineering principles and design, SOLID and OOP.
Experience with mobile platforms ,operating systems and infrastructure
Experience in building flexible and reusable systems
Highly experienced with automated testing
Proficient with CI and SCM
Exemplary communication skills
Team leading experience is a plus
What We're Looking For
Responsibilities
Design and build core infrastructure software for the mobile platforms.
Collaborate with a team of developers, Technical Product Owner, Project Manager and Software Architect to define, design, and ship new features or improvements.
Be responsible for the delivery of your team, ensure that developers have what they need to do the team’s work.
Work with other teams (pods), facilitate collaboration and cross-team knowledge sharing.
Work with outside data sources and APIs.
Unit-test code for robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliability
Work on bug fixing and improving application performance
Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies, patterns, libraries etc. to maximise development efficiency
Conduct Code Reviews for the tasks finished by the team members.
Provide leadership, management, coaching and mentoring for the team.
Stimulate hiring, training, performance reviews and careers plans for team members.
Why Product Madness?
Product Madness is so much more than just a Pool table and a foosball game.
We believe in an honest and transparent approach with our teammates. Company wide weekly Town Halls, All Hands and strategy meetings are just a few ways in which we encourage an open and honest path to achieving complete transparency.
Despite a pandemic, there isn’t a day where we don’t feel connected to one another.
With frequent events, workshops, giveaways, slack coffee and donut sessions we have definitely brought on our office culture to this new virtual world of zoom calls.
We also try to cater for all our staff’s needs – be that a freshly brewed cappuccino made by our professional barista in our free coffee shop or by providing a bountiful supply of tasty snacks to keep us refueled and buzzing.
We love to organise plenty of social get-togethers and action-packed activity days, be it slipping inside an inflatable bumper ball for a mad session of football zorbing or throwing caution to the wind and traversing giddy treetop rope courses at Go Ape. On top of these team-building activities, our lunch and learn workshops, not to mention the lavish Christmas and summer parties, foster that ‘work hard, play hard’ mantra. Our offices are based in the heart of the metropolises of London and Lviv, surrounded by an abundance of diversity and inspiration to keep those ideas flowing.
Our Values
People First
We have the deepest respect for our people and their well being. We know they are exceptionally talented and will always have a choice. We want them to re-choose us every day. We are committed to building a culture where each person's voice will always be heard and addressed.
MAD for More
Always improving, innovating and never settling for the existing. We push all boundaries with courage and ambition to become the world’s best games company.
Champion Together

We excel at what we do but yet remain humble and helpful to our teammates. We champion one another and hold each other to high standards without any egos.
Globally Inclusive
We are all Equal - regardless of the language we speak, where we live, our gender, religion or culture we come from. We want to build a global home, where everyone has the equal opportunity to make an impact.
Customer Focused
We always think from the customer's perspective - be it players or internal customers.
Improving their experience and joy is what drives us. Every client's success is our big win! Company Summary
Product Madness is one of the world's largest mobile game studios, with a global presence. Founded in 2007, we’re today a top-grossing leader in social casino mobile games that are crafted with passion and commitment. Our ambition is to entertain millions of players around the world with our remarkable titles that include Heart of Vegas, Cashman Casino, Lighting Link and FaFaFa™ Gold.
We are Mad about games and the way they bring people together, and that passion and culture is what holds us together as a studio, connects us with the partners we collaborate with, and is what links us to our sister studios across the world.

The role

As a Lead Mobile Developer, you will help shape and develop our mobile team. You will actively lead on architecting and implementing functionality to new and existing mobile applications. Working with our designers you’ll create beautifully designed and well-considered user experiences, as well as thoroughly testing your work through unit testing and device testing. Working within and improving on our dev-ops methodology you will lead on architecting solutions, backlog estimations, specifications and code review.

If you’re passionate about mobile platforms and writing code to create beautiful, user-friendly apps, we would love to meet you. As a Lead Mobile developer, you’ll collaborate with internal teams to develop functional mobile applications within our exciting and engaging team environment.

This is an opportunity to grow and thrive in one of the UK’s leading practices for digital innovation, design and development. If that sounds interesting to you, we’d love to learn more about you.

What You’ll Do
Architect and develop fully functional native and cross-platform mobile applications
Be responsible for end to end technical delivery including overseeing the entire application lifecycle (concept, design, test, release and post release)
Mentor and onboard team members
Be an advocate for engineering best practices
Leading technical strategies across projects and with clients
Contribute and improve the team’s dev-ops process including CI/CD pipelines
Demo and present work to clients/ stakeholders
Testing work to ensure specifications and quality are met
Troubleshoot and debug to optimize performance
Supporting legacy apps to the same high standard as new apps Ensure new and legacy applications meet quality standards
Keeping up to date with mobile development techniques and methodologies
Working to achieve team goals and continuous improvements
Documentation of technical approaches both pre and post project.
Required Skills and Experience
Proven work experience as a Senior or Lead Mobile developer
5 or more years’ experience developing native or cross platform applications using modern approaches
An expert knowledge of object-orientated programming
Experience in software testing techniques
Excellent analytical skills with a good problem-solving attitude
Want and ability to learn new technologies
Excellent written technical communication skills
Strong stakeholder management skills
Ability to ensure that scope is controlled and understood
Ability to architect and articulate solutions to clients and internal teams.
Helpful Skills and Experience
Knowledge of cross-platform frameworks like Xamarin and Flutter
Experience developing for platforms such as UWP, Windows, Mac, etc.
Knowledge of modern mobile architectures
Experiences working with remote and offshore technical teams
Ability to bring your best to the team culture and happiness
Experience working as part of an agile development team.
Qualifications
University Degree (2:1 or above) in a related subject or similar experience/qualifications.

Unsure if you meet all these requirements? Please apply anyway. We’re looking for the right candidate and we would love to hear from you if you think you could be the person we’re looking for.
