Mobile Developer / Software Engineer (Flutter) *Remote WFH 6 month contract £750 p/day outside IR35*. Start-up FinTech that is has a socially responsible credit management app in Beta is seeking a skilled Mobile Developer with Flutter experience.
As a Mobile Developer will design and develop new features and enhancement on the core app and provide subject matter expertise on Flutter, collaborating with a small cross functional Agile team. You'll have exposure across the full software development lifecycle, coding with scalability and security in mind. There's a modern tech stack with Node backend, microservices and Heroku.
Following a remote interview process you can work from anywhere in the UK (or you can pop into the London based office depending on your preference).

Requirements:
You're an experience Mobile Developer with iOS or Android native experience and have experience with Flutter
You have experience of working on scalable apps that see spikes in traffic / user sign-ups
You have a good appreciation of security
You're a collaborative problem solver with great communication skills

Osso VR is the leading virtual reality surgical training and assessment platform. Our technology is being used by the top medical device companies to train thousands of surgeons, on dozens of the latest surgical techniques, in over twenty countries around the world. Our mission is to improve patient outcomes through better training and assessment, increase the adoption of higher value medical technology, and democratize access to the latest surgical techniques globally.Your day-to-day responsibilities include:Designing and building solutions using a variety of technologies across web, desktop and mobile applications as well as cloud-based data analytics and processingCollaborating closely with business stakeholders, working on a small, cross-functional team of developers, testers and designers to build features on our world leading VR surgical training platformBeing responsible for all aspects of the software development lifecycle, including managing and monitoring your code in productionThis is the right opportunity for you if you:Have 3+ years of experience in web application developmentHave 1+ years of experience of PaaS cloud application developmentHave strong knowledge of C# (.NET Core) and JavaScript (Typescript)Have experience working with distributed systems, HTTP and APIsAre happy working across both front-end and back-endAre able to analyze business requirements and work with a team to design solutionsHave excellent communication skills, both verbal and writtenAre a self starter, able to perform multiple tasks with minimal supervisionAre empathetic, compassionate, and motivated by mission-based workHave an eagerness to learn and develop new skillsPreferred qualifications:Experience with Azure Functions, Cosmos DBExperience with SPAs (Aurelia, React, Angular, Vue, etc)Experience with Cloud platforms (Azure preferable)Previous desktop (Electron) and mobile application development (Android, iOS) experienceExperience with build systems, CI/CD (Teamcity, Azure Devops, Github actions)Previous VR development experience (Unity, Oculus Quest)Job Type: Full-timePay: £72,876.10-£159,449.31 per yearAdditional pay:Bonus schemeSchedule:Monday to Friday Osso VR is the leading virtual reality surgical training and assessment platform. Our technology is being used by the top medical device companies to train thousands of surgeons, on dozens of the latest surgical techniques, in over twenty countries around the world. Our mission is to improve patient outcomes through better training and assessment, increase the adoption of higher value medical technology, and democratize access to the latest surgical techniques globally.Your day-to-day responsibilities include:Designing and building solutions using a variety of technologies across web, desktop and mobile applications as well as cloud-based data analytics and processingCollaborating closely with business stakeholders, working on a small, cross-functional team of developers, testers and designers to build features on our world leading VR surgical training platformBeing responsible for all aspects of the software development lifecycle, including managing and monitoring your code in productionThis is the right opportunity for you if you:Have 3+ years of experience in web application developmentHave 1+ years of experience of PaaS cloud application developmentHave strong knowledge of C# (.NET Core) and JavaScript (Typescript)Have experience working with distributed systems, HTTP and APIsAre happy working across both front-end and back-endAre able to analyze business requirements and work with a team to design solutionsHave excellent communication skills, both verbal and writtenAre a self starter, able to perform multiple tasks with minimal supervisionAre empathetic, compassionate, and motivated by mission-based workHave an eagerness to learn and develop new skillsPreferred qualifications:Experience with Azure Functions, Cosmos DBExperience with SPAs (Aurelia, React, Angular, Vue, etc)Experience with Cloud platforms (Azure preferable)Previous desktop (Electron) and mobile application development (Android, iOS) experienceExperience with build systems, CI/CD (Teamcity, Azure Devops, Github actions)Previous VR development experience (Unity, Oculus Quest)Job Type: Full-timePay: £72,876.10-£159,449.31 per yearAdditional pay:Bonus schemeSchedule:Monday to Friday Show more

In 2022, we have an exciting opportunity for a Front-End Mobile Developer (iOS) to join our team. You’ll join a likeminded team in our Leeds based Digital Channels function, with working from home/ remote capability. You’ll design & code usable and accessible mobile experiences with native technologies.
About the role
As Front-End Mobile Developer (iOS), you’ll have the opportunity to –
Build and deploy mobile applications to accommodate all changes required by the business
Provide best practice advice on native pattern & development into the user-led design workshops and end to end journeys
Liaise with business to identify, specify and document development requirements. Recommend solutions that meet customer needs and ensure business users understand
Help define the software architecture of new features for existing apps, future apps
Create effective information architecture models; defining the relationship between the mobile app navigation, device functionality and services the app integrates with, ensuring this matches customer journeys to drive agreed digital outcomes
Design and code innovative & engaging digital mobile experiences to support corporate sales targets, KPI’s and other business requirements, from taking an initial brief through to final implementation of the site
Code engaging user interfaces using native technologies to improve customer experience
Responsible for a full CI/ CD pipeline with both unit and UI testing strategies to ensure a robust product is released
About you
You will have a proven track record as a Front-End Mobile Developer or be ready for that next step up to the role! What will you bring to the role?
Strong understanding of iOS SDK with strong proficiency in Swift
Familiarity with best practice mobile design/ UX patterns (HIGS - Human Interface guidelines for iOS)
Past experience of releasing a mobile app to the relevant store and iterating on its development
Have a quality led development focus, utilising version control, testing and CI
Understanding of RESTful APIs to connect to mobile applications to back-end services
About us
At YBS we don’t have shareholders, we have members. We care about people and that includes you. So here, you’ll be respected for who you are, you’ll be able to bring your whole self to work, and you’ll have everything you need to build a long and rewarding career.
Flexibility. We offer a range of flexible working options without unsocial hours, which can help you find a healthy work-life balance. Whether it’s finishing early for an appointment or fitting your studies and hobbies in around your working hours, we can help make it work for you.
Development. We want you to feel challenged here. Whatever your ambitions, we’re committed to helping you develop your skills and move ahead in your career journey. From day one, we’ll set you up for success with a brilliant induction and full training plan, all designed to get you up to speed quickly.
Inclusivity. We’re passionate about creating an inclusive environment where everyone is welcome and able to be themselves. If you’ll go the extra mile to help our members, you’ll fit right in and feel you belong here.
About our Benefits
We offer lots of fantastic rewards that you can make the most of in and out of work, including:
Holiday. You’ll get 25 days plus Bank Holidays, as well as the option to buy up to a further 5 days.
Bonus. We work together to reach for better at YBS, so when we reach our goals we’re all rewarded, with up to a 10% annual bonus.
Pension. We know how important it is to save towards the future, that’s why we’ll contribute up 11% into your YBS pension.
Healthcare. Health and wellbeing are an important part of life at YBS, when you join us you’ll have access to a range of health benefits to suit your life including private medical insurance, dental and healthcare plans.
My Benefits. When you join YBS you’ll have access to our self-service benefits portal, where you can access a range of retail, hospitality and health discounts.
Ready to apply?
If you’re excited about this role and want to be part of the YBS team, apply now to send us your application.
Want more information?
If you have any questions about this role, please contact Mike Peel on recruitment@ybs.co.uk

Location:
Manchester, GB, M171HH
Requisition ID: 9629
IGT (NYSE:IGT) is a global leader in gaming. We deliver entertaining and responsible gaming experiences for players across all channels and regulated segments, from Lotteries and Gaming Machines to Sports Betting and Digital. Leveraging a wealth of compelling content, substantial investment in innovation, player insights, operational expertise, and leading-edge technology, our solutions deliver unrivaled gaming experiences that engage players and drive growth. We have a well-established local presence and relationships with governments and regulators in more than 100 countries around the world, and create value by adhering to the highest standards of service, integrity, and responsibility. IGT has approximately 10,500 employees. For more information, please visit www.igt.com.


About

IGT is the global leader in gaming. We enable players to experience their favourite games across all channels and regulated segments, from Gaming Machines to Lotteries to Interactive. We have a well-established local presence and relationships with governments and regulators in more than 100 countries around the world and create value by adhering to the highest standards of service, integrity, and responsibility. IGT has over 12,000 employees.

Role Overview

We are currently seeking an enthusiastic and creative Game Developer to join our successful team to create the next generation of interactive mobile, tablet, and desktop web-based gaming products. You will be playing a key role in the design, development, testing and maintenance of our interactive web gaming products. Based in MediaCityUK, Manchester. You will be tasked with developing interactive instant win games for an international audience.

If you have the vision, energy, and a passion for game development, we would like to hear from you.

Due to our international structure, IGT provides you with a challenging multicultural environment where you can use your initiative and contribute to the realization of the company’s targets. IGT strongly believes in personal development and invests continually in training and coaching.
Responsibilities


Developing high-quality and innovative interactive web gaming products for mobile, tablet and desktopPresenting ideas and improvements to enhance our new and existing interactive web gaming productsMaintain our existing interactive web gaming productsCollaboration within the team to reach game product goals
Qualifications

Applicable work experience or relevant bachelor’s degreeStrong knowledge of object-oriented programming conceptsTypeScriptJavaScriptHTML5GITGood teamwork and communication skillsAbility to work independently and as part of a teamA logical approach to problem-solving

Advantageous skills

PixiJSMobxSpineJSGreensockBuild automation tools (Maven, Yarn)Node/NPMAgileGaming development experience

Expected Role Behaviour

Drive results to achieve high-quality work results regardless of work complexityBuild collaborative relationships both internally and externallyDecision making to identify and understand situations; identify opportunities to proactively resolvePersonal energy to proactively address situations and adopt a positive approach; resilience in front of change and obstaclesSelf-leadership to continuously learn and develop yourselfFoster innovation

Keys to Success
Building collaborative relationshipsDecision makingDrive resultsFoster innovationPersonal energySelf-leadership
#LI-SB1

IGT is committed to sustaining a workforce that reflects the diversity of the global customers and communities we serve, and to creating a fair and inclusive culture that enables all our employees to feel valued, respected and engaged. IGT is an equal opportunity employer. We provide equal opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, marital status, national origin, citizenship, covered veteran status, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, or any other legally protected status in accordance with applicable local, state, federal laws or other laws. We thank all applicants for applying; however, only those selected to interview will be contacted.

IGT (NYSE:IGT) is a global leader in gaming. We deliver entertaining and responsible gaming experiences for players across all channels and regulated segments, from Lotteries and Gaming Machines to Sports Betting and Digital. Leveraging a wealth of compelling content, substantial investment in innovation, player insights, operational expertise, and leading-edge technology, our solutions deliver unrivaled gaming experiences that engage players and drive growth. We have a well-established local presence and relationships with governments and regulators in more than 100 countries around the world, and create value by adhering to the highest standards of service, integrity, and responsibility. IGT has approximately 10,500 employees. For more information, please visit www.igt.com.


About

IGT is the global leader in gaming. We enable players to experience their favourite games across all channels and regulated segments, from Gaming Machines to Lotteries to Interactive. We have a well-established local presence and relationships with governments and regulators in more than 100 countries around the world and create value by adhering to the highest standards of service, integrity, and responsibility. IGT has over 12,000 employees.

Role Overview

We are currently seeking an enthusiastic and creative Game Developer to join our successful team to create the next generation of interactive mobile, tablet, and desktop web-based gaming products. You will be playing a key role in the design, development, testing and maintenance of our interactive web gaming products. Based in MediaCityUK, Manchester. You will be tasked with developing interactive instant win games for an international audience.

If you have the vision, energy, and a passion for game development, we would like to hear from you.

Due to our international structure, IGT provides you with a challenging multicultural environment where you can use your initiative and contribute to the realization of the company’s targets. IGT strongly believes in personal development and invests continually in training and coaching.
Responsibilities


Developing high-quality and innovative interactive web gaming products for mobile, tablet and desktopPresenting ideas and improvements to enhance our new and existing interactive web gaming productsMaintain our existing interactive web gaming productsCollaboration within the team to reach game product goals
Qualifications

Applicable work experience or relevant bachelor’s degreeStrong knowledge of object-oriented programming conceptsTypeScriptJavaScriptHTML5GITGood teamwork and communication skillsAbility to work independently and as part of a teamA logical approach to problem-solving

Advantageous skills

PixiJSMobxSpineJSGreensockBuild automation tools (Maven, Yarn)Node/NPMAgileGaming development experience

Expected Role Behaviour

Drive results to achieve high-quality work results regardless of work complexityBuild collaborative relationships both internally and externallyDecision making to identify and understand situations; identify opportunities to proactively resolvePersonal energy to proactively address situations and adopt a positive approach; resilience in front of change and obstaclesSelf-leadership to continuously learn and develop yourselfFoster innovation

Keys to Success
Building collaborative relationshipsDecision makingDrive resultsFoster innovationPersonal energySelf-leadership

listing_jobDesc: UI Front End Developer, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, c £ 28- 32000 + benefits. Slough, Berkshire.Market leading technology company based in Slough, Berkshire are looking for a number of Frontend Developer to join their growing UI/UX Development team. You will be joining a small but growing team, focused on delivering solutions.This role will be accountable for skilfully producing software for the migration of the existing In-house application UI to a new modernised UI running under bootstrap as the primary framework. This is an excellent opportunity to get involved in developing complex systems and enhancing your skills in a fast-paced environment.Duties and responsibilities -Work with the UI/UX designer to ensure changes are implemented in accordance with the provided style guideWhere elements of the UI do not fit, within the UI style guide, work with the UI/UX designer to find solutionsCommunicate and work optimally within internal teams to ensure clear communication of technical issuesProactively investigate, potentially present options for implementing solutions and bug fixes in cooperation with development management and other internal teamsTake ownership and responsibility of components and processes within the team to make tactical and strategic changesExperience required -2+ years of development experienceFluency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, with a willingness to pick up and learn new languages and technologies as neededA full appreciation of configuration management & issue tracking management issues and systemsAptitude for UX / UI Design and an eye for detailA solid understanding of browser capabilitiesAny of the following is an advantage -Experience of Bootstrap, Foundation and/or other responsive frameworks.Systems integrationProgramming experience in .net using VB or C#Working knowledge of Cloud deployments, AWS, etc.Appreciation or experience in software or systems testingMobile/Tablet developmentThis is a great chance to join a growing company and work on a range of new and exciting projects. The role is based in Slough, Berkshire and the salary is likely to be in the range £ 28000 - 32000. If you are interested please send your CV soon.Job Type: PermanentSalary: £28,000.00-£32,000.00 per yearSchedule:Monday to FridayAbility to commute/relocate:Slough, SL1 4NB: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)Reference ID: Indeed334 UI Front End Developer, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, c £ 28- 32000 + benefits. Job Description
Unity 3D Developer
Experience: 2 Years Minimum
Role & Responsibility
Implement game functionality as per communicated design.
Translate design specification into functional game.
Communicate with other team members to establish effective pipeline and integrate media assets.
Design, Build, and Maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable code.
Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.
Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to address and mitigate these problems.
Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization.
Excellent knowledge of Unity3d including experience with C# scripting language / Unreal Game Engine with C++ scripting language, textures, animation, GUI styles, and user session management.
Familiarity with level design and planning.
Experience in developing multi-person game studio.
Experience with game physics and particle systems.
Experience with mobile and console game development.
Experience optimizing memory and space usage for support of older hardware.
Prior experience with a well-known mobile title or AAA titles are a significant asset.
Ability to constantly learn and stay in touch with evolving game standards and development technologies.
Strong understanding of object-oriented programming.
Familiarity with current design and architectural patterns.
Knack for writing clean, readable, and easily maintainable code.
Experience implementing automated testing platforms and unit tests.
Proficient knowledge of code versioning tools {{such as Git, SVN, and Mercurial}}. Job Description

Floot App LtdMobile App DeveloperJob DescriptionWe Are FlootFloot is a one of a kind, market measurement tool allowing for unprecedented insights from independent venues in the UK hospitality industry.The AppA free mobile app provides a valuable customer touchpoint. Customers download to discover the UK’s best independent restaurants, bars and cafes on one free app.Intended to have a rich, interactive and intuitive UI that is used throughout the customer journey.The VenuesBehind the scenes, our large network of independent venues manage their Floot profile via custom built admin console. This serves to centralise hundreds of individual venues providing a great source for venue data collection.The RoleA Developer, working as part of a flexible, rapidly moving team to design, develop and build solutions for the customer, venue and partner facing applications.Create, maintain and implement full web stack across our platforms with a combination of stable and progressive technologiesReact NativeTypescriptNode.jsMongoDB & SQLDevelopment of new features from idea to implementation across all parts of the serviceusing and developing specialisms across wide & diverse skillsetsbuild powerful, cutting-edge UI/UX and supported full-stack featuresWork closely with backend data & infrastructure as part of the wider technical team.RequirementsExperience in JavaScript / TypeScript & React Native. Introduction
The client is looking for a software developer to immediately join their team, approx. 15, staff to continue to expand and deliver their growing client and product activities within Rail, Transport, and other industry sectors.

The Team is a long-standing collective of Developers, Project Managers, and support staff with an abundance of long-standing contracts and newly won work with some of the world’s leading companies. You will always be with work and will be able to work over a portfolio of different projects.

The client has a flexible work environment to suit your needs. You will be able to work fully remote or book a hot desk at one of there offices dotted around the country.

The client provides ongoing training and support to allow you to grow your skillset, new or legacy products, or provide you with the necessary training to progress further throughout the team from Junior through to Principal. The client will also fund you to take Microsoft exams to achieve certifications.
Key responsibilities
Development and support of new and existing mobile and web applications
Join an existing team of talented developers working on a variety of existing and future client applications
Work within a successful team to continuously improve and refine the skills and capabilities of the team
Remain knowledgeable of current software development tools and techniques
Deliver agreed commitments to the stated quality, timescales and cost
Support the Digital Services team to achieve its sales, productivity and profitability targets
Support and contribute to bid production and estimating activities to secure new client opportunities
Skills & experience
Experience in developing applications as a Microsoft Full Stack Developer
Knowledge of front-end languages and libraries (e.g. HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery)
Knowledge of back-end languages (e.g. C#)
Familiarity with databases (e.g. MS SQL Server)
Interest and demonstrable evidence in UI/UX design and development

The client would also like to see some of the below, but this is not essential:

Experience of working in rail or transportation industry
Microsoft accreditation.
Additional benefits
Pension Plan: (Employer doubles contribution up to 5% Employee, 10% Employer)
Life Assurance + Spousal Life Assurance
Holidays: Basic entitlement 25 days (+ bank holidays) with option to buy an additional 15 days or to sell 5 days.
Income Protection Insurance
Annual Professional Fee subscription reimbursed for membership of a professional body
Season Ticket Loan and Cycle to Work Scheme
Insurance: Dental, Health, Private Medical, Travel, Gadget
Digital GP, Flu Jab Vouchers, Eyecare Vouchers and Healthcare Cash Plan
Discounts on annual gym memberships at over 2,500 health clubs, gyms and leisure centres
Critical Illness : This benefit pays out a tax-free cash sum if you suffer a serious illness
Company car (at more Senior levels)

We are looking for an enthusiastic front end developer to join our technical team. We provide electronic proof of delivery, route optimisation & related services to industry leaders across a range of sectors. Our mobile app is linked to a rich web application which helps companies to cut costs, streamline operational processes & improve service. PODFather is quickly increasing its market share across the UK & beyond making it a really exciting time to join our team. We are based in the west of Edinburgh but all our staff are currently working remotely.
Purpose & scope:
As a front end developer you will use your UX experience to help plan & execute projects. You will work with the team to develop, deliver & improve high quality product features while helping to spread understanding and knowledge of UX & UI best practices with product owners and developers.
Your roles and responsibilities will include:
Working with product owners to design & prototype new and updated system modules
Crafting robust & scalable front-end interfaces using Vue.js
Planning & implementing tests to maintain the integrity of the frontend
Enhancing existing code to bring it inline with modern standards
Identifying & implementing new front end technologies.
Producing & maintain design documentation and style guides
We require you to have the following:
The drive to continuously improve your technical & interpersonal skills
The confidence to inspire innovation
Experience working with product owners and user groups
2+ years commercial experience of modern JavaScript (ES6+) and frontend frameworks (Vue.js, React etc)
Hands on experience of browser dev tools, for example Firefox dev tools
Experience writing appropriate tests using tools such as Jest
Excellent communication skills
Preferred skills:
5+ years commercial experience
Experience mentoring other developers
Commercial experience using Vue.js
Experience using design collaboration tools such as Figma
Previous experience of working as part of an agile SCRUM based development team
What you get in return:
Salary: £32,500-£45,000 depending on experience
30 days holiday a year
Opportunity to buy 5 extra holiday days
High spec workstation, multiple monitors & your choice of operating system
Currently working from home
Office with strong transport links & free parking
Training budget
Flexible working hours
Company social events
Life assurance scheme which includes remote GP appointments, mental health support, physiotherapy and employee assistance
Bike to work scheme
Pension plan
Here at PODFather we try to create a working environment that allows employees to develop and grow. It’s important to us that all staff are both supported well, but also challenged, so that no two days are the same, and that the opportunity is there to try new things and learn new skills.

2+ years commercial experience of modern JavaScript (ES6+) and frontend frameworks (Vue.js, React etc)
Hands on experience of browser dev tools, for example Firefox dev tools
Experience writing appropriate tests using tools such as Jest
Excellent communication skills
Preferred skills:
5+ years commercial experience
Experience mentoring other developers
Commercial experience using Vue.js
Experience using design collaboration tools such as Figma
Previous experience of working as part of an agile SCRUM based development team
What you get in return:
Salary: £32,500-£45,000 depending on experience
30 days holiday a year
Opportunity to buy 5 extra holiday days
High spec workstation, multiple monitors & your choice of operating system
Currently working from home
Office with strong transport links & free parking
Training budget
Flexible working hours
Company social events
Life assurance scheme which includes remote GP appointments, mental health support, physiotherapy and employee assistance
Bike to work scheme
Pension plan
Here at PODFather we try to create a working environment that allows employees to develop and grow. It’s important to us that all staff are both supported well, but also challenged, so that no two days are the same, and that the opportunity is there to try new things and learn new skills.
Colin McCreadie, Managing Director, PODFather Here at PODFather we try to create a working environment that allows employees to develop and grow. It’s important to us that all staff are both supported well, but also challenged, so that no two days are the same, and that the opportunity is there to try new things and learn new skills.
Colin McCreadie, Managing Director, PODFather Show more

The role

We’re looking for a full time Junior Developer to work from our head office at Leeds Dock.

About us

Founded in 1999, we’re an award winning communications agency with offices in Leeds, Manchester and London.

We pride ourselves on offering our clients an integrated creative response, thinking not along departmental lines, but using all the skills and talent we have in-house to come up with the most creative and effective ways to answer briefs and build brands.

When it comes to our client and project portfolio, we’ve always specialised in not specialising. Our philosophy is that the wider the scope of the sectors we work on and in, the more we build our creative insight, knowledge, influence and understanding. Which is the major reason why the work we produce remains fresh, challenging and engaged, regardless of project, sector or client.

Our current roster spans everything from beer, supermarket retail and boutique fitness, to engineering software, ethical investment and major animation studios. It’s an eclectic list.

What we’re looking for

This is an exciting role for someone keen to use the latest web technologies and browser functionality to create websites that wow clients.

We’re offering the right candidate a competitive salary based on experience along with some great perks:

Personal trainer
Incentive scheme
25 days holiday
Birthday off
ilkStock summer festival
Regular nights out

Responsibilities

Work with Senior Developer to develop and deliver unique creative projects
Write clean, lean, well-documented code
Help to maintain existing client and internal websites
Day to day contact with account managers and our design team

Required 1+ years experience in:

WordPress
Custom theme development
Custom plugin and functionality development
Hooks, actions, filters and utilising theme functions
Custom post types & taxonomies
Good knowledge of HTML5 and CSS3
Knowledge of PHP
Experience with Sass or SCSS
JavaScript knowledge and knowledge of popular JavaScript libraries/frameworks
Skills with responsive & mobile techniques
Ability to debug front-end site issues using inspector tools

Desirables

Experience working with APIs and integrations
Awareness of SEO & Accessibility Standards
Previous experience in working with ACF blocks in Gutenberg

To apply email your CV and if possible a link to your portfolio website to lauren@ilkagency.com

Please note you will be required to work from the Leeds office at least three days a week. The role

Job Overview
Android Developer - B2B saas scale-up - £75K
Job Description
I am partnered with a B2B saas scale up who are born out of a big consultancies digital accelerator platform. Their mobile data platform is pioneering the digital transformation of the utilities industry using GPS & data science to improve field operations & safety.

With the financial backing for a big 5 consultancy & an established client base they are now looking to scale their mobile development with a Android developer. Their tech stack is Android/Kotlin but they are also starting to use React Native for cross platform development.

Requirements

3+ years of mobile development
1+ year plus of Kotlin (bonus if you have React Native experience but they are willing to teach)
Experience working in start-ups or scale-ups is desired
Based in the UK & able to travel twice per week


If you want to work work for a well backed disruptive start-up, then apply here now!

Role description We are looking for a developer to join the team who understands front-end development but is also keen to gain an understanding of full stack development, from design through to continuous delivery, continuous integration. Other work may include application development, desktop and mobile and backend systems such as API’s.We don’t expect you to have knowledge of all of these but a keenness to learn new technologies essential.We work within DevOps, including pipelines and release management and use Test Driven Development. We do both backend and frontend development, so if you don't already have experience in these areas this is a fantastic opportunity to learn and improve your skills.Required experience Front end development experience working in HTML, CSS and JavaScriptA minimum of 2 years’ experienceSelf-driven and keen to learnDesired experienceWe work across a range of technologies so would be interested to hear more about your skills and expertise, particularly any experience of C#, .Net, PHP, Java, React, Vue, Angular, Typescript.You don't need these skills to apply as we will offer support and training to enable you to learn new skills and technologies.About thecitysecretthecitysecret is an established company based in the north of England which has been working within the software industry for over 20 years. During this period, we have established a reputation within the financial sector and are now branching into other areas to focus on growth and bringing our many of years knowledge with it.We are on track to becoming a market leader in providing all things tech for businesses within the area and to achieve this, we recognise that the backbone of the business, and the key to our growth is our people.The focus of the business is to work with organisations to bring tech into their business or help with existing software, providing IT services to business with our in-house IT team.Here at thecitysecret we work in a wide range of technologies and are always keen to learn new ones, allowing members of the team to become specialists in languages, but also have the confidence to take on new challenges.The projects we work on are exciting and always different, we always have something new to learn and being in a small team, you gain a good understanding of most parts of the development lifecycle.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: £30,000.00-£40,000.00 per yearBenefits:Additional leaveCasual dressCompany pensionProfit sharingWork from homeSchedule:Monday to Friday Role description We are looking for a developer to join the team who understands front-end development but is also keen to gain an understanding of full stack development, from design through to continuous delivery, continuous integration. Who we are looking for
An iOS Mobile Application Developer to play a key role in developing and enhancing our high profile Gaming apps available throughout the world.

You will be working with the latest technology and best digital minds to create online betting and gaming experiences. In a fast-paced environment with few boundaries you will develop quick, robust and scalable systems.

The day to day work is interesting, challenging and fast paced amidst a hardworking and delivery focused company ethos. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology’s greatest challenges.

This role is eligible for inclusion in the Company’s hybrid working from home policy.
Preferred skills and experience
Experience developing iOS Applications.
Strong understanding of the Swift programming language.
Experience developing high performance, low footprint applications.
Experience using native iOS development tools including Xcode and the range of iOS SDKs.
Ability to develop multitasking and asynchronous code.
Good understanding of the modern application lifecycle.
Ability to bring new ideas and fresh approaches to existing problems.
Experience working on a codebase in parallel with other developers and using git source control.


Main Responsibilities
Developing native iOS applications using the latest versions of Swift and Xcode.
Refining, extending and improving a range of existing native applications.
Identifying bottlenecks, code complexity and bugs to fix.
Helping maintain code quality organisation and automation.
Reviewing team member’s code and providing feedback on code improvements.
Assisting and coaching other team members in app development.


Want to become part of the team?

The benefits of working with us
Bonus Schemes
Recognition for your performance and hard work.
Company Pension
Preparing you for later life with a top pension.
Employee Assistance Programme
Supporting the wellbeing of you and your family.
Eye Care
In a digital world, we help take care of your vision.
Income Protection
Your income is protected, just in case.
Life Assurance
Peace of mind for your family in any eventuality.
Tax Free Childcare Scheme
A bit extra in your pocket to help with your little ones.
Life Events and Long Service

Game Designer
Miniclip is looking for a Game Designer to join our Derby (UK) Studio. This is an exciting role working with a leading digital games and entertainment company.
DUTIES
Design and craft mission gameplay experiences and game features that deliver strong player engagement, retention, and monetization.
Take ownership of mission gameplay design and implementation, collaborating cross discipline to create new and exciting scenarios and moment-to-moment gameplay.
Participate as a key member of the product team across the product life-cycle, working on games in production, and live titles, owning and creating high-impact gameplay content updates for our existing portfolio of games.
Plan and execute mission designs within Unity using our proprietary tools and editors, from inception to finished product.
Collaborate across the team to expand and iterate internal tools used for mission and gameplay implementation.
Present and articulate your designs across the team, upholding and championing the game vision and core pillars.
Review and iterate gameplay designs and mission implementation both during production and post release, incorporating feedback from key stakeholders and directing mission changes to balance game content based on analytics data.
Help identify and deconstruct new markets and opportunities, expanding the portfolio of the company and staying in the cutting edge of the mobile gaming industry.
Support the team with subject-matter expertise on mobile & social game design.
SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
Significant experience of level and gameplay design for action/shooter titles, preferably on mobile.
An excellent knowledge and understanding of level and gameplay design.
Experience across the product life-cycle, from prototyping, through production, to updating a live free-to-play game.
Strong knowledge of the mobile & social game space, with exceptional understanding of current design techniques to deliver excellent engagement, retention, and monetisation.
Understanding of and experience with reviewing game analytics, developing insights based on data to make better informed design decisions.
Strong grasp of mobile user-experience design, and ability to consider & empathise with many different types of players.
Creative problem solver, with proven ability to create compelling gameplay.
Relentlessly self-critical: always sees the pros and cons of each approach, and works tirelessly to improve design solutions. Prolific with high quality, well-thought-through proposals.
Mature judgment, able to balance between innovation and setting reasonable goals.
Drive, initiative and ability to self-manage effectively.
Highly organised, with a track-record of guiding & advising others, and prioritising appropriately to deliver to tight deadlines.
Great collaborator, with superb written and oral communication skills.
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
Miniclip Derby is a dynamic and cutting-edge games studio based in Derbyshire, on the edge of the stunning Peak District national park.
Alongside an elite team of veteran game developers, you will be working in our spacious office just outside Derby, with ample parking and convenient for public transport, working with enthusiasts and professionals from the games industry. We like to maintain a friendly and relaxed atmosphere, and our office comes with a pool table, table tennis, big screen with games consoles, fridge with complimentary drinks for all staff, fresh fruit & snacks delivered weekly, and regular team events.
In addition to a generous holiday allowance, we also have a fantastic benefits package, with BUPA medical cover, dental cash plan, cover for life insurance, pension plan and flexible working.
ABOUT MINICLIP
Miniclip is a global leader in digital games with a mission of ‘unleashing the gamer in everyone’. The Company develops, publishes and distributes highly engaging games to an audience of over 250 million monthly active users across mobile, social and online platforms. They operate in eight countries, with a global workforce of over 900 people across 13 locations.
Founded in 2001, the Company has successfully grown a huge global audience in over 195 countries and across six continents. Miniclip has a unique understanding of the digital games space and has developed a strong portfolio of over 60 high-quality mobile games, extensive worldwide distribution, and an internationally recognised brand name. To date, Miniclip's digital games, which include the franchises 8 Ball Pool™, Golf Battle™, Football Strike™, Carrom Pool™, and Agar.io™ have generated more than 3 billion downloads. Miniclip has more than 45 million daily active players reaching people across the world in the pursuit of ‘unleashing the gamer in everyone’.
In February 2015, Miniclip was excited to receive a large majority investment from Tencent, one of the world’s largest technology companies and the world’s largest games publisher. This new chapter in Miniclip’s history strengthens the Company’s position, with Tencent recognising its achievements to date and future potential.
In the past three years, as part of their ambitious growth plans, Miniclip have been delighted to welcome the teams from Playsport (famous for Motorsport Manager), Yakuto (creators of Darts of Fury), Masomo (home of Head Ball 2), Ilyon (designers of Bubble Shooter), Eight Pixels Square (Sniper Strike) operating as Miniclip Derby, Gamebasics (creators of OSM Online Soccer Manager) now operating as Miniclip Netherlands, Green Horse Games (home of Football Rivals), and most recently Supersonic Software Ltd., trading as Puzzling.com (the team behind the highly successful Puzzle Page and Picture Cross) to the Miniclip Group.
For more information, visit http://corporate.miniclip.com Game Designer

Join a team of passionate marketing professionals at MarCloud - a fast-growing marketing automation consultancy making waves in the Pardot and Salesforce space.

Would you like to learn HTML/CSS and coding best practice emails?
Do you love to be proactive and use your initiative?
Are you super organised?
Consider yourself a strategic thinker?
Do you have Salesforce and/or Pardot experience?
Have a good understanding of B2B marketing?
If you read each of those questions and thought yes, yes, yes… we’d like to chat.
Since 2017, our agency has grown from a one-man-consultant to a team of Pardot and Salesforce experts and we’re only just getting started.
We’re recruiting for a Junior Email Developer because we are building out our development team and have optimistic growth plans! Even through Covid we have been performing exceptionally.
What you’ll be accountable for:

Using Dreamweaver to build custom email templates
Using Litmus to test and ensure mobile responsiveness across all platforms
Setting email templates up in Pardot for clients
Supporting the MarCloud team on Pardot development projects and solving complex development problems

Getting involved in the creating of Landing Pages and Form templates
Supporting MarCloud's growth and getting involved in new ideas for the business

Proactively looking for solutions that help our clients long-term
Communicating clearly and eloquently with our team and clients
Personal growth and sharing knowledge with the team

We’re looking for somebody agile, who brings a sense of fun and optimism to work and is passionate about marketing technology. Basic HTML/CSS development experience is essential and being able to learn quickly is key to being successful in this role.
What you can expect from us:

The trust and freedom to test sound ideas in order to find what works.

We're pretty laid back in the office because the work can be pretty hard. You can expect a relaxed, friendly atmosphere even when we're zoned in on client work. This role offers flexible working.
The most important thing in MarCloud is its people. We're a people business and put great emphasis on building a positive team culture where we can learn from each other and enjoy each other's company as we grow the team! We have monthly outings where we grab a beer or tea and do something fun (bowling, ghetto golf, arcade...)
We're a unique business in how we're positioned and are on track to becoming the best Pardot consultancy in the world. We'd argue we're already the best in Europe! There are only a handful of others doing what we're doing but we have our own special way of doing things which is making us stand out in the industry.


Perks:
Flexible working
Office dog
2 Weeks off at Christmas
Private healthcare
Great office atmosphere and laid-back people!
We need help on our mission and want to continue building on our great reputation with Salesforce and the industry as a whole.

Location: Central London
Job Type: Full time
Why join us?
If you love food and technology as much as we do, you’ll love life at Vita Mojo. We’re on a mission to revolutionise the hospitality experience for operators and their customers. Through our smart digital products, we’re powering the digital transformation of your favourite pubs, bars and restaurants. And we want a world where everyone gets the meal they’re hoping for. Each and every time.
Our Vita Mojo DNA
We’re proud to have built an award-winning digital platform. Vita Mojo is a positive, energetic and forward-thinking place to work, and when you become a Moji, you’ll be joining a supportive team who’ve always got your back. Our passion for technology and food is matched only by our support for our people.
About the role
We’re looking for a developer with multiple years of experience in hybrid cross-platform mobile app development with an excellent understanding of the mobile app ecosystem. You will be a key member of our growing Engineering team.
We’ve grown 1000% over the past 18 months and we’re aiming to triple that again over the next 12 months. Are you ready to be a part of that?

The day-to-day
During the first 90 days you’ll start to:
Work within an agile team to deliver across the entire product life cycle: concept, design, build (code), deploy, test, release, and maintain/support outstanding products in a DevOps environment
Collaborate with Product, Design and QA teams to deliver robust, secure, scalable, tested, and documented capabilities.
Fully participate in relevant scrum events including planning and estimation, daily scrums, sprint reviews, and retrospectives.
Build new mobile app features and improve existing ones with our various frontend apps built on React.
Drive software architecture and design principles, test-driven development, team standards, and best practices e.g. code quality, improving the code base, agile ways of working, technical debt control.
About you
1+ year experience with Java for Android in production
1+ year with Swift and Objective-C for iOS in a commercial environment
Prior experience with using WebViews to host Web applications and debugging know-how
1+ years of experience in web development using React JS, Redux
Strong understanding of deployment lifecycle for both Android and iOS (build, deploy to App Store and Play Store, TestFlight, certificate management, etc)
Ability to work independently and investigate/overcome challenges around existing JavaScript code bases, build scripts and build environments (CI)
Willingness with learning new technologies around native Android and iOS development
Good knowledge of Git
Fluent in English
Nice to have:
Experience with React Native
Understanding of agile development practices, testing (unit and integration) and tools of the trade (Jira, Bitbucket, Confluence, etc
Experience with Cordova/Ionic
Experience with CI/CD automation for mobile app build and deployment
Work perks and benefits
Our approach. We work on a hybrid model which means that once a week teams come into the office for an optional team collaboration day, and the other four days are spent working from home (or hot-desking in the office if that’s your jam!).
We’re proud of the flexibility that we offer our Mojis (check us out on Flexa’s Global Top 100 companies!) and want to promote a positive work/life alignment. A one-size-fits-all approach won’t work for every Moji and team, and we encourage you to have conversations with your line manager and team to understand your work preferences and team needs.
The aim is to ensure that Mojis are able to maximise their potential, build trust with their teams, establish an effective work/life alignment and also meet the needs of our growing business!
Your tech kit. We want to supply you with the best hardware to get the job done. We will set you up with your basic kit when you start and anything else you need once you have some time to get your feet on the ground.
Work from home kit. When you join we’ll work with you to understand your work from home needs, and get you set up to be your most productive while working from home.
️ Your hours. Where possible, you set your own hours to get the work done in line with your team and company needs. If you’re an early riser, come in as early as you like; if you need to do the morning school run, come in a bit later. At the end of the day, the work needs to be done but we also need you to balance that with life.
Your work environment. Our bright and spacious offices offer lots of natural light, a jungle of plants, and different spaces to relax and focus on what you need to do.
Food and drink. We stock all the coffee and tea you can drink when in the office and we’re never without snacks!
Your budget. You have a monthly £80 wellbeing and lifestyle allowance available through your own personal wallet. Spend it on anything (within reason!) that will help improve your life.
Your development. We have found that Mojis who thrive at Vita Mojo embrace a growth mindset and are proactive about their development, find ways to contribute and grow in non-linear (and linear!) ways. We offer a £600 L&D budget to support you in that development and to gain the skills, knowledge and relationships you need to soar, whether at Vita Mojo or later on in your development journey.
Your mental health. Through our partnership with Spill, you can ask a therapist for advice, schedule a one-off therapy session, or use a series of therapy sessions. We also offer Mental Health Days to use in moments when you need to take a day for some additional space to refocus your energies. Personal coaching is available to all Mojis through our partnership with MoreHappi, to help you grow and reach your goals!
Your holidays. We believe in finding your work life alignment and want you to take advantage of your 25 days of leave, plus public holidays. Your holiday allowance increases after each complete calendar year of service, up to 28 days.
Carer’s Leave. We understand life happens and you may need to take some time to support your loved ones. Whether that be looking after your sick dog, friends or family members. We offer one week (5 days) paid leave to all Mojis.
Welcoming a child into your life. We have enhanced Parental leave policies! Parental leave is offered to all Mojis after 3 months at the company. Parental leave is the collective term and includes maternity, paternity, adoption leave and surrogacy. Our leave policy is meant to help you navigate through this time as successfully as possible.
We recognise both the primary caregiver (the person who spends most time with the child) and the secondary (typically this is the non-birthing parent). Primary caregivers receive full pay for the first 16 weeks and 50% pay up to week 32. But need more time off? No problem, you can take up to 52 weeks (statutory) with us!
Secondary caregivers receive full pay for the first 4 weeks and an additional 2 weeks after 36 months of continuous service. It's up to you when you start your leave, we are here to support you through the whole process.
Your health. We offer 10 days of full pay sick leave.
Your birthday. We love celebrating birthdays, whether through baked goods or gifts, and you also get the day off on (or around) your birthday every year.
Your social spirit. We love socialising with our fellow Mojis, whether through monthly drinks in the office, quarterly offsite socials (both virtual and in person), celebrating milestones, or anything else that comes up, we enjoy hanging out with each other!
Dog friendly. We love our furry friends who visit the office! Calling all responsible pet owners to join us! Location: Central London
Job Type: Full time
Why join us?
If you love food and technology as much as we do, you’ll love life at Vita Mojo. We’re on a mission to revolutionise the hospitality experience for operators and their customers. Through our smart digital products, we’re powering the digital transformation of your favourite pubs, bars and restaurants. And we want a world where everyone gets the meal they’re hoping for. Each and every time.
Our Vita Mojo DNA
We’re proud to have built an award-winning digital platform. Vita Mojo is a positive, energetic and forward-thinking place to work, and when you become a Moji, you’ll be joining a supportive team who’ve always got your back. Our passion for technology and food is matched only by our support for our people.
About the role
We’re looking for a developer with multiple years of experience in hybrid cross-platform mobile app development with an excellent understanding of the mobile app ecosystem. You will be a key member of our growing Engineering team.
We’ve grown 1000% over the past 18 months and we’re aiming to triple that again over the next 12 months. Are you ready to be a part of that?

The day-to-day
During the first 90 days you’ll start to:
Work within an agile team to deliver across the entire product life cycle: concept, design, build (code), deploy, test, release, and maintain/support outstanding products in a DevOps environment
Collaborate with Product, Design and QA teams to deliver robust, secure, scalable, tested, and documented capabilities.
Fully participate in relevant scrum events including planning and estimation, daily scrums, sprint reviews, and retrospectives.
Build new mobile app features and improve existing ones with our various frontend apps built on React.
Drive software architecture and design principles, test-driven development, team standards, and best practices e.g. code quality, improving the code base, agile ways of working, technical debt control.
About you
1+ year experience with Java for Android in production
1+ year with Swift and Objective-C for iOS in a commercial environment
Prior experience with using WebViews to host Web applications and debugging know-how
1+ years of experience in web development using React JS, Redux
Strong understanding of deployment lifecycle for both Android and iOS (build, deploy to App Store and Play Store, TestFlight, certificate management, etc)
Ability to work independently and investigate/overcome challenges around existing JavaScript code bases, build scripts and build environments (CI)
Willingness with learning new technologies around native Android and iOS development
Good knowledge of Git
Fluent in English
Nice to have:
Experience with React Native
Understanding of agile development practices, testing (unit and integration) and tools of the trade (Jira, Bitbucket, Confluence, etc
Experience with Cordova/Ionic
Experience with CI/CD automation for mobile app build and deployment

Expenses for travelling to the office will be paid for.As our Mobile Developer, you will be responsible for growing our in house technology capabilities and taking ownership of our technology.What We Are Looking For:Strong background in developing mobile apps (React Native).Blockchain experience preferable (Algorand, JavaScript).Knowledge in both front and backend (React Native / Node.JS).Experience working in/with startups is preferable.Responsibilities:Overseeing our technology build and owning the technology processes.Working with outsourced resources where applicable.Developing overall technology strategy and our road map.Building on and iterating our Beta platform.Be part of the core team making decisions on the overall business.Benefits:We’re passionate about working with employees to create a package that truly benefits and supports them. Introduction
Are you an out-of-the-box and forward-thinker? At the IBM Client Innovation Centre we are always looking for superstars to work on multiple exciting projects, in a friendly and energetic working environment. If this is you, and you're eager to learn, whether you have 1 or 20 years of experience, we'd love to hear from you!

Your Role and Responsibilities

Envision how people experience products and bring that vision to life in a way that feels inspired, refined and magical
Tackle complex tasks and transform them into intuitive, accessible and easy-to-use designs for billions of customers around the world (novice to expert)
Collaborate with researchers, engineers and product managers throughout design process – from creating research protocols, personas, scenarios, information architecture and wireframes to building user interface prototypes
At each stage, must anticipate what our users need, advocate for them and ensure that the final product surprises and delights them.
You will use your expertise in application development to evaluate and select development methods, processes, standard methodologies and tools

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

Min of 3+ years of experience in IOS/ Android app development
2+ years’ experience developing software in Objective-C, Java, C, C++, or C#
2+ years Object Oriented programming experience or equivalent education
Experience in iterative software development environments (Agile, Kanban)
Experience with Test-Driven Development, Continuous Integration and other Agile practices
Good experience in using Apple’s XCode for software development
Experience in standard debugging techniques such as logging, LLDB, and/or Instruments to localize and correct software defects
Understanding of the challenges related to mobile development including battery and radio usage as well as CPU and memory constraints
Understanding of common design patterns including Model-View-Controller
Hands on experience using smartphones and/or tablets preferably iPhone and/or iPad
Strong understanding of ARC as it relates to iOS Memory Management, including the concepts of strong vs weak
And/or
Proven knowledge of Android SDK, different versions of Android, and how to deal with different screen sizes
Familiarity with RESTful APIs to connect Android applications to back-end services
Proven knowledge of Android UI design principles, patterns, and best practices
Experience with offline storage, threading, and performance tuning
Ability to design applications around natural user interfaces, such as “touch”
Familiarity with the use of additional sensors, such as gyroscopes and accelerometers
Knowledge of the open-source Android ecosystem and the libraries available for common tasks
Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirements
Familiarity with cloud message APIs and push notifications
A knack for benchmarking and optimization
Understanding of Google’s Android design principles and interface guidelines
Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git
Familiarity with continuous integration

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Ability to design/develop/support new/existing apps, and perform unit testing and integration testing.

As an equal opportunities’ employer, we welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds. However, for you to be eligible for this role, you must have the valid right to work in the UK for at least a 2-year period prior to applying. For certain projects, all applicants must be British nationals with 5 years of unbroken residency, ideally 10 years.
Unfortunately, we do not offer visa sponsorship and have no future plans to do so.

About Business Unit
The Client Innovation Centre (CIC) is an innovative and exciting part of IBM. A fast-paced and dynamic business built to deliver high-value technical services to world renowned clients. All of our employees work in a consultancy environment on a variety of exciting projects across a range of sectors. Every project has its own unique working environment - this enables our employees to build their experience, skillset and network. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems?

Your Life @ IBM
Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.

About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.


At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Location Statement
IBM wants you to bring your whole self to work and for you this might mean the ability to work flexibly. If you are interested in a flexible working pattern, please talk to our recruitment team to find out if this is possible in the current working environment.

Being You @ IBM
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status. Introduction

Proven knowledge of Android SDK, different versions of Android, and how to deal with different screen sizes
Familiarity with RESTful APIs to connect Android applications to back-end services
Proven knowledge of Android UI design principles, patterns, and best practices
Experience with offline storage, threading, and performance tuning
Ability to design applications around natural user interfaces, such as “touch”
Familiarity with the use of additional sensors, such as gyroscopes and accelerometers
Knowledge of the open-source Android ecosystem and the libraries available for common tasks
Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirements
Familiarity with cloud message APIs and push notifications
A knack for benchmarking and optimization
Understanding of Google’s Android design principles and interface guidelines
Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git
Familiarity with continuous integration

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Ability to design/develop/support new/existing apps, and perform unit testing and integration testing.

As an equal opportunities’ employer, we welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds. However, for you to be eligible for this role, you must have the valid right to work in the UK for at least a 2-year period prior to applying. For certain projects, all applicants must be British nationals with 5 years of unbroken residency, ideally 10 years.
Unfortunately, we do not offer visa sponsorship and have no future plans to do so.

About Business Unit
The Client Innovation Centre (CIC) is an innovative and exciting part of IBM. A fast-paced and dynamic business built to deliver high-value technical services to world renowned clients. All of our employees work in a consultancy environment on a variety of exciting projects across a range of sectors. Every project has its own unique working environment - this enables our employees to build their experience, skillset and network. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems?

Your Life @ IBM
Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.

About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.


At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Location Statement
IBM wants you to bring your whole self to work and for you this might mean the ability to work flexibly. If you are interested in a flexible working pattern, please talk to our recruitment team to find out if this is possible in the current working environment.

Being You @ IBM
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status. Introduction
Are you an out-of-the-box and forward-thinker? At the IBM Client Innovation Centre we are always looking for superstars to work on multiple exciting projects, in a friendly and energetic working environment. If this is you, and you're eager to learn, whether you have 1 or 20 years of experience, we'd love to hear from you!

Your Role and Responsibilities

Envision how people experience products and bring that vision to life in a way that feels inspired, refined and magical
Tackle complex tasks and transform them into intuitive, accessible and easy-to-use designs for billions of customers around the world (novice to expert)
Collaborate with researchers, engineers and product managers throughout design process – from creating research protocols, personas, scenarios, information architecture and wireframes to building user interface prototypes
At each stage, must anticipate what our users need, advocate for them and ensure that the final product surprises and delights them.
You will use your expertise in application development to evaluate and select development methods, processes, standard methodologies and tools

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

Min of 3+ years of experience in IOS/ Android app development
2+ years’ experience developing software in Objective-C, Java, C, C++, or C#
2+ years Object Oriented programming experience or equivalent education
Experience in iterative software development environments (Agile, Kanban)
Experience with Test-Driven Development, Continuous Integration and other Agile practices
Good experience in using Apple’s XCode for software development
Experience in standard debugging techniques such as logging, LLDB, and/or Instruments to localize and correct software defects
Understanding of the challenges related to mobile development including battery and radio usage as well as CPU and memory constraints
Understanding of common design patterns including Model-View-Controller
Hands on experience using smartphones and/or tablets preferably iPhone and/or iPad
Strong understanding of ARC as it relates to iOS Memory Management, including the concepts of strong vs weak
And/or
Proven knowledge of Android SDK, different versions of Android, and how to deal with different screen sizes
Familiarity with RESTful APIs to connect Android applications to back-end services
Proven knowledge of Android UI design principles, patterns, and best practices
Experience with offline storage, threading, and performance tuning
Ability to design applications around natural user interfaces, such as “touch”
Familiarity with the use of additional sensors, such as gyroscopes and accelerometers
Knowledge of the open-source Android ecosystem and the libraries available for common tasks
Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirements
Familiarity with cloud message APIs and push notifications
A knack for benchmarking and optimization
Understanding of Google’s Android design principles and interface guidelines
Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git
Familiarity with continuous integration

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Ability to design/develop/support new/existing apps, and perform unit testing and integration testing.

As an equal opportunities’ employer, we welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds. However, for you to be eligible for this role, you must have the valid right to work in the UK for at least a 2-year period prior to applying. For certain projects, all applicants must be British nationals with 5 years of unbroken residency, ideally 10 years.
Unfortunately, we do not offer visa sponsorship and have no future plans to do so.

Job Introduction

Corporate Digital & Applications (CDA) is a small team with a big impact. We make an exciting range of apps used by nearly every BBC staff member in their work to deliver content and value to the audience. We look after the BBC intranet, internal web and mobile apps and external corporate sites which receive millions of views from our audience every month.
We have a modern technology stack and use a range of AWS technologies such as Lambda, OpenSearch, S3, and Aurora. We mainly build services using JavaScript, with our front-ends typically being React and our primary API being serverless GraphQL.
As the BBC reaffirms its digital ambition, we have an opportunity for a Junior Software Engineer to join our team and work alongside other developers to improve and develop our suite of products. We are looking for someone who has a good basic understanding of web development using HTML, CSS and JavaScript and with a passion to learn and develop their skills. There will be opportunities to gain experience in both front end and back end development.
We will take a genuine interest in your career and help you develop and grow with training, hands-on experience and regular feedback in a friendly and supportive atmosphere. We also want you to take regular personal development time to develop your skills in your own way.
Main Responsibilities
Learn and apply relevant technologies used by the team to make effective contributions to our code base.
Work closely with the product team
Participate in the development of effective software that meets given specifications.
Participate in the team's software development methodologies, such as pairing, code reviews, agile planning and continuous delivery
Write appropriate unit tests to ensure code-quality
Are you the right candidate?

We are keen to hear from you if you have:
A passion for web development and a willingness to learn and develop
Some experience in modern programming languages and/or frameworks
Excellent communications skills and a collaborative attitude
Troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
Basic knowledge of software code versioning and repositories (such as Git)
About the BBC

We don’t focus simply on what we do – we also care how we do it. Our values and the way we behave are important to us. Please make sure you’ve read about our values and behaviours in the document attached below.
Diversity matters at the BBC. We have a working environment where we value and respect every individual's unique contribution, enabling all of our employees to thrive and achieve their full potential.
We want to attract the broadest range of talented people to be part of the BBC – whether that’s to contribute to our programming or our wide range of non-production roles. The more diverse our workforce, the better able we are to respond to and reflect our audiences in all their diversity.
We are committed to equality of opportunity and welcome applications from individuals, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, socio-economic background, religion and/or belief. We will consider flexible working requests for all roles, unless operational requirements prevent otherwise.
To find out more about Diversity and Inclusion at the BBC, please click here
Package Description

Band: C
Contract type: Permanent
Location: London
We’re happy to discuss flexible working. Please indicate your choice under the flexible working question in the application. There is no obligation to raise this at the application stage but if you wish to do so, you are welcome to. Flexible working will be part of the discussion at offer stage.
Excellent career progression – the BBC offers great opportunities for employees to seek new challenges and work in different areas of the organisation.
Unrivalled training and development opportunities – our in-house Academy hosts a wide range of internal and external courses and certification.
Benefits- We offer a competitive salary package, a flexible 35-hour working week for work-life balance and 26 days (1 of which is a corporation day) with the option to buy an extra 5 days, a defined pension scheme and discounted dental, health care, gym and much more. Job Introduction
